我们在现代早期法国商业文学中发现的犹太人形象，吸收并阐述了广泛的宗教主题。宗教和经济不忠的共生关系在所谓的 “法庭文学” 中得到了具体体现，该文学收集并评论了著名和不知名的审判。最早尝试这种体裁的人之一是律师和多面手弗朗索瓦·加约特·皮塔瓦尔（1673-1743），他将大量耸人听闻的审判记述收集在一本名为《重要审判》（Causes célèbres et interessantes）的书中。第一版在 1734 年至 1743 年间分二十卷出版，并以多种形式重印。被选入该文集的著名审判包括拉斐尔·列维的审判，他于 1670 年在梅斯因宗教仪式谋杀被判处死刑。79

Pitaval in this work for the first time embedded the legend of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange in an account of blood libel, the ultimate crime of which Jews were accused.80 Cleirac had hinted at the analogy between usury and the desecration of the host (and thus ritual murder, since in Catholic doctrine the consecrated host is the body of Christ) through his reference to Villani (chapter 2 ). Transposed to the northeastern region of France, the analogy became explicit. Echoing the language of Canon 67, Pitaval maintained that “these abominable Jews” committed “all sorts of impieties” and oppressed Christians “with their excessive usuries” in times of both war and peace. He described in detail a scheme for fooling local peasants into buying low-quality horses imported from Germany as an instance of “the usuries and pillages perpetrated by the Jews of Metz.”81

皮塔瓦尔在这部作品中首次将犹太人发明汇票的传说嵌入了对血腥诽谤的描述中，这是犹太人被指控的最终罪行。（80克莱拉克通过提及维拉尼第 2 章），暗示了高利贷和亵渎主机（因此也是仪式上的谋杀，因为在天主教教义中，被献祭的主机是基督的身体）之间的类比。转移到法国东北部地区，这个比喻，变得很明确。皮塔瓦尔呼应教规 67 的语言，坚持认为 “这些可恶的犹太人” 犯下了 “各种不敬”，并在战争与和平时期 “以其过度的高利贷” 压迫基督徒。他详细描述了一个骗取当地农民购买从德国进口的劣质马匹的计划，作为 “梅斯的犹太人犯下的高利贷和掠夺行为” 的一个例子。81

Causes célèbres et interessantes left behind the buoyant port cities of Bordeaux and Marseilles to situate the legend of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange in Lorraine, where Jews were impoverished and segregated, and mostly made a living as lenders to the poor peasants who despised them. Pitaval also resurrected the name of Giovanni Villani, which the Savarys had elided and which was indirectly tied to ritual murder. In the same years during which Causes célèbres et interessantes first appeared, more enlightened philosophes portrayed Jews as sympathetic victims of the Inquisition and used blood libels as weapons of anticlerical propaganda even as they continued to indulge in spiteful representations of rabbinical Judaism and Jewish society (chapter 6 ). Causes célèbres et interessantes did not embrace this antipapal agenda, constructing instead the most sinister version of the legend to date, one that did not become mainstream but arguably found an audience, especially among the legal professionals who were its principal readers.

著名和有趣的事件把波尔多和马赛这些繁荣的港口城市抛在脑后，把犹太人发明汇票的传说放在洛林，在那里，犹太人是贫穷的，被隔离的，大多以向鄙视他们的贫穷农民放贷为生。皮塔瓦尔还复活了乔瓦尼·维拉尼（Giovanni Villani）的名字，萨瓦里家族曾对这个名字避而不谈，而这个名字也间接地与仪式性谋杀联系在一起。在Causes célèbres et interessantes首次出现的那几年，更开明的哲学家将犹太人描绘成宗教裁判所的同情受害者，并将血腥诽谤作为反教会宣传的武器，甚至继续沉溺于对犹太教和犹太社会的唾弃（第 6 章）。“著名和有趣的事件” 没有接受这种反教皇的议程，而是构建了迄今为止最邪恶的传奇版本，这个版本没有成为主流，但可以说找到了观众，特别是在作为其主要读者的法律专业人士中。

Conclusion

总结

Depicted by the Annales school as a century of famines, deflation, and rebellions, the French grand siècle long suffered bad press among economic historians. More recently, scholars of the seventeenth century (particularly Anglo-phones) have insisted on a portrayal focusing less on pauperization and more on the degree of commercialization that all strata of French society experienced during this time. The peasantry, once believed to have been caught in a perpetual Malthusian trap, has emerged from this revisionist literature as capable of rational economic decisions.82 The opulent aristocracy, once portayed as parasitical in its conspicuous consumption, is now widely considered to have been able to make long-term investments, and all the more so after the introduction of the venality of certain offices.83 French port cities, from Saint-Malo to Bordeaux, where merchants involved in overseas trade invariably handled bills of exchange, were early participants in the rising Atlantic economy.84 Even the least prosperous French men and women did not live autarkic lives. According to a study of marriage and property disputes among families of artisans, shopkeepers, and laborers in Lyon and Nantes, “litigation over debt was the single largest category in court case loads” in seventeenth-century France.85 In short, noblemen, bourgeois, artisans, peasants, and peddlers, whether in remote rural villages or in thriving coastal cities, all grew dependent on the thick economic networks linking Paris to the provinces and the entire kingdom to its colonial outposts.

被年鉴学派描述为一个充满饥荒、通货紧缩和叛乱的世纪，法国大纪元长期以来在经济史学家中饱受恶评。最近，研究 17 世纪的学者（尤其是英国人）坚持不把重点放在贫困化上，而把重点放在法国社会各阶层在这一时期所经历的商业化程度上的描述。曾经被认为是永远陷入马尔萨斯陷阱的农民，在这种修正主义文学中被认为是有能力做出理性的经济决定。82富裕的贵族，曾经被描述为在其显眼的消费中寄生，现在被广泛认为能够进行长期投资，而且在引入某些办公室的腐败后更是如此。83法国的港口城市，从圣马洛到波尔多，参与海外贸易的商人无一例外地处理汇票，是崛起的大西洋经济的早期参与者。84即使是最不富裕的法国男人和女人也没有过着自在的生活。根据一项对里昂和南特的工匠、店主和工人家庭的婚姻和财产纠纷的研究，在 17 世纪的法国，“债务诉讼是法院案件数量中最大的一类”。85简而言之，贵族、资产阶级、工匠、农民和小贩，无论是在偏远的农村还是在繁荣的沿海城市，都越来越依赖于连接巴黎与各省以及整个王国与殖民地前哨的庞大经济网络。

What mechanisms existed at this time to match creditors and lenders? How were those who possessed capital able to evaluate a potential borrower’s reputation? Merchant handbooks like those by the elder Savary dispensed practical instructions on how to minimize risk—for example, by tending to one’s accounts and correspondence—while also outlining in broad strokes the profile of a virtuous merchant and his opposite: Jews and Armenians. The little attention that economic historians have paid to these stereotypes suggests that they regard them as irrelevant to the period’s mercantile culture, mere vestiges of the religious prejudice of the time. In fact, the recurrence of these stereotypes in early modern commercial literature was neither casual nor superfluous. A presumed homology between religious and economic trustworthiness informed works such as those by the Savary family, in which Jews and non-Catholics symbolized economic guile. Not normally considered a source for the study of European attitudes toward Jews, in reality these early texts of the “science of commerce” reveal the extent to which old and new clichés about Jewish usury informed the culture of early modern European merchants.

这时有什么机制来匹配债权人和贷款人？那些拥有资本的人如何评估一个潜在借款人的信誉？像老萨瓦里的那些商人手册就如何将风险降至最低提供了实用的指导 —— 例如，通过处理自己的账户和信件 —— 同时也大致概述了一个有道德的商人和他的对手的形象。犹太人和亚美尼亚人。经济史学家对这些定型观念的关注很少，这表明他们认为这些定型观念与当时的商业文化无关，仅仅是当时宗教偏见的残余。事实上，这些定型观念在早期现代商业文学中的反复出现既不是偶然的，也不是多余的。宗教和经济上的可信赖性之间的假定同源性为萨瓦里家族的作品提供了信息，在这些作品中，犹太人和非天主教徒象征着经济上的狡诈。通常不被认为是研究欧洲人对犹太人态度的来源，但实际上，这些早期的 “商业科学” 文本揭示了关于犹太人高利贷的新旧陈词滥调在多大程度上影响了现代早期欧洲商人的文化。

By the late seventeenth century, the word “Jew” in France carried an array of meanings, all hostile in tone, that could be applied to individuals who were not themselves Jewish. They ranged from the medieval trope of the Jewish pawnbroker and rag dealer to the figure of the omnipotent Jewish merchant who undercut his competitors in the Levant. Antoine Furetière’s dictionary asserted that “by a man rich like a Jew, we mean a very rich man.” It added that “we call usurer a merchant who cheats or extorts, [or we call him] a Jew, because Jews are notable usurers, double-dealers, and deceptive” (“usuriers, frippiers, & trompeurs”).86 The same dictionary proposed an expansive definition of usury that encompassed not only the charging of interest (following the strictest precept of canon law) but also “an illicit profit that derives from using money in ways contrary to the laws.”87

到 17 世纪末，“犹太人” 这个词在法国有一系列的含义，都是敌对的语气，可以适用于那些本身不是犹太人的人。这些含义包括从中世纪的犹太典当商和碎布商到在黎凡特削弱其竞争对手的无所不能的犹太商人形象。安托万·福雷蒂埃（Antoine Furetière）的字典中宣称，“像犹太人一样富有的人，我们指的是非常富有的人”。它还说，“我们称高利贷者为欺骗或勒索的商人，或者我们称他为犹太人，因为犹太人是著名的高利贷者、双重交易者和欺骗者”（“usuriers, frippiers, & trompeurs”）。86同一本词典对高利贷提出了一个广泛的定义，不仅包括收取利息（遵循教规法最严格的戒律），还包括 “以违反法律的方式使用金钱而产生的非法利润”。87

The definition was hardly clear-cut. Civil laws defined usury in the context of noncommercial loans (rentes ) but were famously vague in all other respects (chapter 3 ). The 1673 ordonnance de commerce , which Savary was instrumental in drafting, forbade merchants from building interest rates into the principal when issuing bills of exchange and from charging compound interest (title VI, arts. 1–2), but both infractions were difficult to detect and reflected practices so common as to make the law meaningless. Regrettably, no systematic studies have been done on commercial litigation in Old Regime France. Judging from existing collections of jurisprudence, however, the adjudication of disputes over bills of exchange remained contentious and was complicated by a lack of firm criteria.88

这个定义并不明确。民法在非商业贷款（租金）方面定义了高利贷，但在所有其他方面都是有名的模糊（第三章）。萨瓦里参与起草的 1673 年商业法令禁止商人在签发汇票时将利率计入本金，并禁止收取复利（第六章，第 1-2 条），但这两种违法行为都很难被发现，而且反映的做法非常普遍，以至于使法律毫无意义。遗憾的是，人们没有对旧制度下的法国商业诉讼进行系统研究。然而，从现有的判例集来看，对汇票纠纷的裁决仍然是有争议的，并且由于缺乏确定的标准而变得复杂。88

In any case, a punitive judicial system cannot be the only foundation for a commercial society. Written and unspoken norms also guide merchants’ behavior. In early modern France, inevitably some merchants tested the normative consensus and the reach of the law when they acted in bad faith. At the time of Savary’s composition of Le parfait négociant , Colbert’s mistrust of merchants was inspiring highly centralized commercial policies, including the creation of a network of royal inspectors charged with reporting back to Paris. Ultimately, it was impossible for the state to control every production site and marketplace in the kingdom. Top-down regulation anywhere requires internalized cultural norms of conduct in order to achieve its intended aims. In this fragile institutional environment, merchant manuals and legal commentaries spelled out not only the written rules of conduct, but also a broader range of shared values necessary to sustain the operations of respectable and successful négociants . These works combined advice and prescriptions with spurious information, including anecdotes that served as warnings. Such was the function of the legend of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange, a poignant narrative meant to convey the dangers that lurked behind the exceedingly complex financial instruments on which the market increasingly relied.

无论如何，惩罚性的司法系统不能成为商业社会的唯一基础。成文和不言而喻的规范也指导着商人的行为。在现代早期的法国，当一些商人不守信用时，不可避免地会考验规范的共识和法律的影响力。在萨瓦里创作《准商人》时，科尔贝尔对商人的不信任激发了高度集中的商业政策，包括建立一个皇家检查员网络，负责向巴黎汇报。最终，国家不可能控制王国的每个生产基地和市场。任何地方的自上而下的监管都需要内部化的文化行为规范，以实现其预期目标。在这种脆弱的制度环境下，商人手册和法律评论不仅阐明了书面的行为规则，而且还阐明了更广泛的共同价值观，这些价值观是维持可敬和成功的商人的运作所必需的。这些作品将建议和处方与虚假的信息结合起来，包括作为警告的轶事。犹太人发明汇票的传说就是如此，这个凄美的叙述旨在传达市场日益依赖的极其复杂的金融工具背后所潜藏的危险。

Nurtured by prejudice, the legend was canonized by some of the very works of Europe’s ars mercatoria that imparted practical teachings on how to succeed as a négociant . It even survived almost intact the objections raised in 1690 by Dupuis de la Serra, who exposed serious flaws in the story. Savary’s credentials were undoubtedly greater than Dupuis de la Serra’s, although the latter also enjoyed remarkable success. A fertile cultural terrain supported the legend’s diffusion. Accusations about the usurious character of Jews issuing bills of exchange could even be introduced in court as aggravating charges, as happened in Toulouse in 1745.89 Although the most influential and reckless treasurers of eighteenth-century France—John Law (1671–1729), Samuel Bernard (1651–1739), and Jacques Necker (1732–1804)—were all Calvinists, and thus controversial in their own right, moralizing tales about the destructive character of credit more often centered on Jews. The fate of Bernard, the single largest financier of the crown during the War of Spanish Succession, is emblematic in this regard. As France’s mounting public debt led to a dramatic currency depreciation and lenders ceased to accept Bernard’s bills of exchange, rumors spread that he was Jewish (a false claim facilitated by Huguenots’ frequent use of Old Testament names). Through a dazzling series of textual distortions and cross-references, which began with a comment by Voltaire, Bernard was turned into the iconic figure of the devious Jewish banker who undermined the well-being of the state in order to enhance his own interests.90

在偏见的滋养下，这个传说被欧洲重商主义的一些作品奉为圭臬，这些作品传授了关于如何成功成为商人的实际经验。它甚至在 1690 年 Dupuis de la Serra 提出的反对意见中几乎完好无损地保存下来，他揭露了故事中的严重缺陷。萨瓦里的资历无疑比杜普伊斯·德拉·塞拉的资历要高，尽管后者也取得了显著的成功。肥沃的文化土壤支持了这个传说的传播。关于发行汇票的犹太人的高利贷性质的指控甚至可以作为加重处罚的指控被引入法庭，正如 1745 年在图卢兹发生的那样。89尽管十八世纪法国最有影响力和最鲁莽的司库 —— 约翰·劳（1671-1729）、塞缪尔·伯纳德（1651-1739）和雅克·内克尔（1732-1804） —— 都是加尔文教徒，因此他们本身就有争议，但关于信贷的破坏性的道德故事更多地是以犹太人为中心。在这方面，西班牙王位继承战争期间王室最大的单一，伯纳德的命运就是一个象征。由于法国的公共债务不断增加，导致货币急剧贬值，贷款人不再接受伯纳德的汇票，关于他是犹太人的谣言也随之传播开来（胡格诺派教徒经常使用《旧约》中的名字，为这种虚假的说法提供了便利）。通过一系列令人眼花缭乱的文本歪曲和交叉引用，从伏尔泰的评论开始，伯纳德被变成了狡猾的犹太银行家的标志性人物，他破坏了国家的福祉，以提高自己的利益。90

The transformation of the figure of the Jewish usurer into that of the Jewish financier unfolded against the backdrop of the general diffusion of the paper economy. Local context, too, colored the process. The works of Savary father and sons placed the legend of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange in the context of changing power dynamics in the Mediterranean. French trade in the Levant was on the ascent in the last quarter of the seventeenth century, especially after 1673, when the crown brokered a more advantageous diplomatic and commercial treaty with the Ottoman Empire than those negotiated by rival European powers. Marseilles, France’s foremost Mediterranean port and Savary’s window onto the world of overseas trade, was dear to Colbert but resisted his plans for the settlement of foreign communities there. In 1669, the same year that the edict promoting the greater involvement of noblemen in overseas trade was enacted, Colbert granted exclusive control over French trade in the Mediterranean to the Chamber of Commerce of Marseilles, which thereafter also elected the French consuls who assumed diplomatic roles in North Africa and the Middle East.91 This oligopolistic body, which represented the interests of local shipowners, wholesale merchants, and bankers, opposed Colbert’s desire to attract Jews and Armenians to Marseilles and ultimately won.

犹太高利贷者的形象转变为犹太金融家的形象，是在纸张经济普遍扩散的背景下展开的。地方背景也为这一过程增添了色彩。萨瓦里父子的作品将犹太人发明汇票的传说置于地中海地区权力动态变化的背景下。法国在黎凡特的贸易在十七世纪的最后四分之一处于上升阶段，特别是在 1673 年之后，当时王室与奥斯曼帝国达成了比欧洲敌对势力所谈判的条约更有利的外交和商业条约。马赛是法国最重要的地中海港口，也是萨瓦里通向海外贸易世界的窗口，科尔贝尔对它很感兴趣，但却抵制他在那里建立外国社区的计划。1669 年，在促进贵族更多地参与海外贸易的法令颁布的同一年，科尔贝尔将法国在地中海的贸易的独家控制权授予了马赛商会，此后该商会还选举了在北非和中东承担外交角色的法国领事。91这个代表当地船东、批发商和银行家利益的寡头垄断机构，反对科尔贝尔吸引犹太人和亚美尼亚人到马赛的愿望，并最终取得了胜利。

The figure of the dominant Jewish merchant who allegedly cheated and outmaneuvered the négociants of Marseilles was a Provençal variant on a widespread theme. Once again, existing tropes about Jews and commerce were adapted to local conditions and contingent struggles. Far from being mere ways of speaking, inimical representations of minority groups also provided a rationale for exclusionary legislative measures. Representations of Jewish and Armenian traders as unfair competitors were in line with the xenophobic commercial policies promoted by the Chamber of Commerce of Marseilles, which was fiercely jealous of its sphere of influence. Five years after Jews were expelled from Marseilles, Armenians who were Ottoman subjects were forbidden from selling silk (their principal trading item) there on the grounds that their textiles were of inferior quality.92

据称，占主导地位的犹太商人欺骗并战胜了马赛的商人，这个人物是一个广泛主题的普罗旺斯变体。现有的关于犹太人和商业的陈词滥调再一次适应了当地的条件和偶然的争斗。对少数群体的敌意表述远非仅仅是说话的方式，它还为排他性的立法措施提供了理由。犹太人和亚美尼亚商人是不公平的竞争者的说法与马赛商会推行的排外商业政策是一致的，该商会对其影响范围有着强烈的嫉妒。在犹太人被驱逐出马赛的五年后，身为奥斯曼帝国臣民的亚美尼亚人被禁止在马赛销售丝绸（他们的主要贸易品），理由是他们的纺织品质量低劣。92

Jews were seen as more threatening than any other minorities because many assumed that their wicked habits could contaminate the rest of society. In Cleirac’s tale of the Jewish invention of marine insurance and bills of exchange, the real danger was that “Lombards and Cahorsins” were imitating Jews’ worst behavior. The logic reverberated with particular strength in Bordeaux, where crypto-Judaism was an institutionalized phenomenon, but it appealed to Christians’ imagination the world over. In the 1670s, an anonymous report addressed to the municipal government of Marseilles described Jewish merchants as practicing usury, employing counterfeit currencies, and overcharging customers. To these accusations, it added a more damaging claim: the presence of Jews “Judaified” young men in Marseilles to the “disgrace of our religion.”93 This example shows that the specter of Judaism could be invoked as an argument for regulation in the commercial sphere even in places where crypto-Judaism was not a lived reality.

犹太人被视为比其他少数民族更具威胁性，因为许多人认为他们的恶习会污染社会的其他部分。在克莱拉克关于犹太人发明海事保险和汇票的故事中，真正的危险是 “伦巴第人和卡奥尔森人” 正在模仿犹太人的最坏行为。这种逻辑在波尔多反响特别强烈，在那里，隐蔽的犹太教是一种制度化的现象，但它吸引了全世界的基督徒的想象力。1670 年代，一份写给马赛市政府的匿名报告描述了犹太商人放高利贷、使用假币和向顾客多收费的行为。除了这些指控外，报告还增加了一个更具破坏性的说法：犹太人的存在使马赛的年轻人 “犹太化”，使 “我们的宗教蒙羞”。93这个例子表明，即使在隐性犹太教没有成为现实的地方，也可以援引犹太教的幽灵作为商业领域监管的理由。

In spite of many objections, Colbert hoped to persuade the Chamber of Commerce of Marseilles of the utility of enticing Jews and Armenians to settle there. His plan was neither unique nor radical. Livorno, Marseilles’ main rival, was only one among other European port cities, including Venice, Amsterdam, Hamburg, and London, that had given Jews (particularly those fleeing Iberia) exceptional privileges on account of their perceived commercial and financial competence. The reason of state arguments that inspired these policies became so widely accepted that Jewish leaders learned to spin them to their own advantage. In Venice, Rabbi Simone Luzzatto (1583–1663) penned the best-known early modern defense of Jewish commerce and successfully fended off an impending decree of expulsion. To persuade the Senate of the republic of the Jews’ utility to the state, he inflated their economic contribution by more than doubling the number of Jewish residents in the city (to 6,000, from the actual number of 2,400) and used the resulting number as the multiplier for his estimates of the taxes and custom duties that he claimed Jews paid.94 More-over, Luzzatto reasoned, Jews were more valuable and less ominous than other communities of foreign merchants because they lacked the backing of a state and could not wage military or commercial wars on their own: because they were not in direct competition with Catholic subjects of the republic, they could only help them flourish. Shortly thereafter, the Amsterdam rabbi Menasseh ben Israel (1604–1657) adopted an analogous strategy to plead with Oliver Cromwell to readmit Jews to England in 1655–1656—a request that was tacitly granted.95

尽管有很多人反对，科尔贝尔还是希望说服马赛商会，让他们相信吸引犹太人和亚美尼亚人在那里定居是有好处的。他的计划既不独特也不激进。马赛的主要竞争对手里窝那，只是欧洲其他港口城市中的一个，包括威尼斯、阿姆斯特丹、汉堡和伦敦，这些城市因其被认为具有商业和金融能力而给予犹太人（尤其是逃离伊比利亚的犹太人）特殊的特权。激发这些政策的国家理由已被广泛接受，以至于犹太领导人学会了将其转化为自己的优势。在威尼斯，拉比西蒙·卢扎托（1583-1663）撰写了最著名的现代早期犹太商业辩护，并成功抵御了即将到来的驱逐令。为了说服共和国参议院相信犹太人对国家的作用，他夸大了他们的经济贡献，将城市中的犹太居民人数增加了一倍多（从实际的 2400 人增加到 6000 人），并将这个数字作为他所称的犹太人支付的税收和关税的估计倍数。94此外，卢扎托推断，犹太人比其他外国商人群体更有价值，也不那么不祥，因为他们缺乏国家的支持，不能独自发动军事或商业战争：因为他们不与共和国的天主教臣民直接竞争，他们只能帮助他们繁荣发展。此后不久，阿姆斯特丹拉比 Menasseh ben Israel（1604-1657）采取了类似的策略，恳求 Oliver Cromwell 在 1655-1656 年重新允许犹太人进入英国 —— 这一请求被默许了。95

At this mid-seventeenth-century moment, it was reasonable for Colbert to argue for the benefits of inviting foreigners to settle in Marseilles. He likely assumed that the corporatist structure of Old Regime France and the system of royal oversight would tame any potential disruption generated by the contractual equality he would extend to Jewish and Armenian merchants. But it appears that he underestimated the backlash generated by the legal and social reforms that he had set in motion, reforms that chipped away small but significant building blocks of the very corporatist architecture designed to distinguish a merchant from a nobleman, a foreign merchant from a native guild member. The city’s commercial elites were thus placed on the defensive. In this conflict, Marseilles could count on more than its fierce municipal tradition to oppose Colbert’s plan. Advocates of economic protectionism also marshaled widely held religious stereotypes as weapons of resistance. Jews and Armenians could open doors in the Levant, these opponents argued, but could they be contained—or would they insinuate themselves among the upstanding négociants of the free port that Colbert wished to create? Commercial credit and, more than any other instrument of the sort, bills of exchange epitomized the voluntaristic character of a commercial society in which the economic power of an individual mattered more than his personal status. The disruption they engendered was more than financial: it went to the heart of ingrained notions of hierarchy and authority, including political authority, as the next chapter will show.

在十七世纪中期，科尔贝尔为邀请外国人在马赛定居的好处进行论证是合理的。他可能认为，法国旧政体的公司制结构和王室的监督制度会抑制他向犹太和亚美尼亚商人提供的合同平等所产生的任何潜在破坏。但他似乎低估了他启动的法律和社会改革所产生的反弹，这些改革削弱了旨在区分商人和贵族、外国商人和本地行会成员的公司主义结构中微小但重要的组成部分。因此，该市的商业精英们被置于防御状态。在这场冲突中，马赛可以依靠的不仅仅是其激烈的市政传统来反对科尔贝尔的计划。经济保护主义的倡导者们还将广泛存在的宗教成见作为抵抗的武器。这些反对者认为，犹太人和亚美尼亚人可以在黎凡特打开大门，但他们能否被控制住，或者说他们会不会渗透到科尔贝尔希望建立的自由港的正直贵族之中？商业信贷和汇票比其他任何工具都更能体现商业社会的自愿性质，在这个社会中，个人的经济实力比他的个人地位更重要。它们所造成的破坏不仅仅是金融方面的：它涉及到根深蒂固的等级和权威概念的核心，包括政治权威，正如下一章所显示的。

6

Between Usury and the “Spirit of Commerce”

在高利贷和 “商业精神” 之间

TWO DATES DOMINATE THE history of French Jews in the eighteenth century: January 28, 1790, and September 27, 1791. In the span of eighteenth months, for the first time in the history of Europe, Jewish men acquired the same civil and political rights as their non-Jewish peers. A small fraction of the population of the kingdom (some 35,000, or 0.125 percent of all inhabitants), Jews on the eve of the Revolution loomed far larger in the French collective imagination than their demographic presence warranted. Hardly a homogenous group, French Jews formed a mosaic of different communities, each with its own traditions, privileges, and degrees of acculturation to Christian society. We have already encountered the richest, though not the largest, Jewish group living in and around Bordeaux, a group prominently represented among the merchants involved in the Atlantic trade. These Sephardic traders were also the French Jews who most adopted the habits and manners of their Catholic peers. By contrast, their more numerous brethren in Alsace and Lorraine were largely confined to peddling and small-scale moneylending in the countryside, were frequently accused of practicing usury, and lived more insular lives. Paris had only a tiny Jewish community, which was not distinguished by particular cultural or economic achievements, and the poorest of the Jews of Avignon sought better fortunes in Bordeaux to no avail. One of the questions this chapter addresses is the extent to which these different social realities informed new iterations of the legend and the views of advocates and opponents of the expansion of Jewish rights.

在十八世纪法国犹太人的历史上，有两个日期占据了重要地位。1790 年 1 月 28 日和 1791 年 9 月 27 日。在 18 个月的时间里，犹太人在欧洲历史上第一次获得了与他们的非犹太人同龄人一样的公民和政治权利。犹太人只占王国人口的一小部分（约 35,000 人，占所有居民的 0.125%），在大革命前夕，他们在法国人的集体想象中的地位远远超过他们在人口方面的存在。法国犹太人并不是一个同质化的群体，他们形成了一个由不同社区组成的马赛克，每个社区都有自己的传统、特权和对基督教社会的适应程度。我们已经遇到了居住在波尔多及其周边地区的最富有的犹太群体，尽管不是最大的，这个群体在参与大西洋贸易的商人中占有突出的地位。这些塞法尔族商人也是最多采用天主教同行的习惯和礼仪的法国犹太人。相比之下，他们在阿尔萨斯和洛林的数量更多的兄弟们主要局限于在农村从事小贩和小规模的放贷活动，经常被指责为放高利贷，而且生活得更加孤僻。巴黎只有一个很小的犹太社区，没有特别的文化或经济成就，而阿维尼翁最贫穷的犹太人在波尔多寻求更好的财富，但却没有结果。本章要讨论的一个问题是，这些不同的社会现实在多大程度上影响了传说的新版本以及扩大犹太人权利的倡导者和反对者的观点。

Emancipation was a watershed moment in both Jewish history and the history of Western liberalism. By conferring formal equality in the legal and political order on a group long deemed unworthy of it, it reshaped the meaning of Jewish identity. Treatments of Jewish emancipation, however, are quite different in the historiography of European Jewry and that of France. Accounts of the Jewish past almost invariably pause at emancipation, while most studies of the French Revolution relegate it to a footnote.1 This split is curious. A great deal of ink has been spilled on the fact that women did not achieve equality during the Revolution and African slaves in the French Caribbean were freed only temporarily. Historians rightly take eighteenth-century conceptions of women and blacks and, more recently, the interplay of gender and race as illustrations of the patent limits of the notions of progress and universalism conceived by the Enlightenment and the Revolution.2 Jews rarely figure in this early history of human rights, but their fate is instructive. Compared to women and the black population of the French colonies, adult Jewish men of some means gained the most from the Revolution. The process through which a group that for centuries had been regarded as inimical to Christian society came to be granted civil and political rights therefore sheds light on the contradictions of the nascent egalitarianism of the revolutionary period.

解放是犹太历史和西方自由主义历史上的一个分水岭。通过将法律和政治秩序中的正式平等赋予一个长期被认为不值得的群体，它重塑了犹太人身份的意义。然而，在欧洲犹太人的历史学和法国的历史学中，对犹太人解放的处理是完全不同的。对犹太人过去的描述几乎无一例外地在解放问题上停顿下来，而大多数对法国大革命的研究则将其归为一个脚注。1这种分裂是很奇怪的。大量的笔墨被泼洒在妇女在大革命期间没有实现平等，而法国加勒比海地区的非洲奴隶只是暂时得到了解放。历史学家们正确地将 18 世纪的妇女和黑人概念，以及最近的性别和种族的相互作用，作为启蒙运动和大革命所设想的进步和普遍主义概念的明显局限的例证。2犹太人很少出现在这段早期的人权历史中，但他们的命运是有启发的。与妇女和法国殖民地的黑人相比，有一定经济能力的成年犹太男子从大革命中获得的利益最大。因此，一个几个世纪以来一直被视为基督教社会的敌人的群体被授予公民和政治权利的过程，揭示了革命时期新生的平等主义的矛盾所在。

Among scholars of European Jewish history, emancipation remains a controversial topic. Most studies concentrate on its consequences for Jewish life, notably the restructuring of the institutional relations between the state and Jewish organizations, the changing place of religion in Jewish self-definition, and the false promises that formal equality made to those Jews who sought to assimilate. No less relevant and contentious is the question of how Jews came to be perceived as worthy of equality—that is, the social and intellectual changes that led to this turning point. Most historians today favor a gradualist interpretation and insist on the variety of paths emancipation followed across Europe. Within this camp, an influential argument emphasizes the politics of commerce espoused by certain western European states, France included, as the principal driver of integration of segments of the Jewish diaspora into Christian society. David Sorkin argues that for the “port Jews” of Sephardic extraction, who in the course of the eighteenth century developed cultural traits and a legal status that set them apart from their Ashkenazic brethren, emancipation was “not a rupture or radical departure but merely a completion of a process that had begun two centuries before.” The Sephardic Jews of southwestern France are a case in point because they “were already living beyond the autonomous community in merchant corporations or voluntary communities” and therefore “gained emancipation through a confirmation of their existing privileges” rather than by the removal of legal disabilities.3

在研究欧洲犹太历史的学者中，解放仍然是一个有争议的话题。大多数研究集中在它对犹太人生活的影响上，特别是国家和犹太组织之间机构关系的重组，宗教在犹太人自我定义中地位的变化，以及正式的平等对那些寻求同化的犹太人的虚假承诺。同样具有相关性和争议性的是，犹太人如何被视为值得平等的问题，也就是导致这一转折点的社会和思想变化。今天，大多数历史学家赞成渐进式的解释，并坚持认为欧洲各地的解放之路是多种多样的。在这个阵营中，一个有影响力的论点强调，包括法国在内的某些西欧国家所支持的商业政治，是将散居的犹太人群体融入基督教社会的主要动力。大卫·索尔金认为，对于具有塞法尔血统的 “港口犹太人” 来说，他们在 18 世纪发展了文化特征和法律地位，使他们有别于他们的阿什肯纳兹兄弟，解放 “不是断裂或彻底的离开，而只是完成了两个世纪前就开始的进程”。法国西南部的塞法尔犹太人就是一个例子，因为他们 “已经生活在自治社区之外的商业公司或自愿社区中”，因此 “通过确认他们现有的特权而获得解放”，而不是通过消除法律障碍。3

My reading of the place occupied by the legend of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange in eighteenth-century French debates puts this gradualist thesis to the test. It does so not only by considering alternative interpretations of Jewish history, but also by bringing French and Jewish history to bear on one another more than has been done so far.4 Now that the anti-Marxist impetus that dominated the revisionist historiography on the French Revolution during the last quarter of the twentieth century has lost steam, the economic life and institutions of Old Regime France have sparked new interest, especially among Anglophone historians. Like earlier work, however, this recent scholarship overlooks the roles that Jews played in the marketplaces of the kingdom and in eighteenth-century economic thought.5

我对犹太人发明汇票的传说在 18 世纪法国辩论中所占据的地位的解读，对这一渐进论进行了检验。它不仅考虑了对犹太历史的其他解释，而且比迄今为止更多地将法国和犹太历史联系起来。4现在，在 20 世纪最后 25 年主导法国大革命修正主义史学的反马克思主义动力已经消失，法国旧政权的经济生活和机构已经引发了新的兴趣，特别是在英语国家的历史学家中。然而，与早期的工作一样，最近的学术研究忽视了犹太人在王国的市场和十八世纪的经济思想中发挥的作用。5

What I propose in this chapter should prompt historians of Jewish emancipation to square the faith they often place in commerce as a driving force in the transition from toleration to equality with the limited and contentious scope that commercial interests played in revolutionary rhetoric.6 Historians of the French Enlightenment, for their part, will find that depictions of Jewish economic roles test the inclusivity of the Enlightenment trope of commerce as sociability. A number of eighteenth-century French authors regarded commerce as a capacious category that transcended mere economic exchanges and, in its broadest sense, represented bonds of sociability that, though compatible with absolutism, cut across geographical frontiers and legally sanctioned social ranks. Even when singled out as the spinners of far-flung commercial webs, Jews remained marginal to this Enlightenment portrait of commercial society, and no debate ensued about the degree to which Jewish merchants actually belonged to those voluntary, interest-based associations that were said to foster new bonds between strangers.7

我在这一章中提出的建议应该促使犹太解放的历史学家们将他们对商业作为从宽容到平等过渡的推动力的信心与商业利益在革命言论中所发挥的有限和有争议的范围进行比较。6法国启蒙运动的历史学家则会发现，对犹太人经济角色的描述检验了启蒙运动中商业作为社会性的特质的包容性。一些 18 世纪的法国作家认为商业是一个宽泛的范畴，它超越了单纯的经济交流，在最广泛的意义上，它代表了社会关系的纽带，虽然与专制主义相容，但跨越了地理边界和法律认可的社会等级。即使被挑出来作为遥远的商业网络的编织者，犹太人在这幅启蒙运动的商业社会画像中仍然处于边缘地位，而且对于犹太商人究竟在多大程度上属于那些自愿的、基于利益的协会，也没有进行辩论，据说这些协会可以促进陌生人之间的新联系。7

To recover the centrality of Jewish emancipation to the history of the Revolution demands not only that we examine how Enlightenment concepts of commerce fared once the hierarchical society to which they were tailored came tumbling down, but also that we consider the fears that newly emancipated Jews elicited. In so doing, we can appreciate the extent to which Jewish emancipation served as a litmus test for the Revolution as a whole insofar as this event marked the formal transition from a society of status (in which an individual’s rights and obligations were tied to the corporate group to which he was assigned, usually at birth) to a society of contract (in which, in principle, every eligible man was free to enter into contract with other equally free male individuals and to choose from a large menu of contractual choices). Rival visions of Jews and of commerce, I wish to show, are excellent guides for reassessing the inconsistencies of this transition and its longer-term legacies.

要恢复犹太人解放在大革命历史中的核心地位，不仅要求我们研究启蒙时期的商业概念在它们所适应的等级社会崩溃后的表现，还要求我们考虑新解放的犹太人所引起的恐惧。通过这样做，我们可以了解犹太人的解放在多大程度上成为整个革命的试金石，因为这一事件标志着从地位社会（在这种社会中，个人的权利和义务与他通常在出生时被分配到的企业集团相联系）正式过渡到契约社会（在这种社会中，原则上，，每个有资格的人都可以与其他同样自由的男性个人签订契约，并从大量契约选择菜单中进行选择）。我想说明的是，犹太人和商业的对立愿景是重新评估这一过渡的不一致性及其长期遗产的绝佳指南。

This chapter hinges on two moments: the reworking of the meaning of the legend of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange by Montesquieu in the 1740s and the debates on emancipation that occurred during the last quarter of the century. I argue that the discursive and political contexts in which the legend was evoked account for the vastly different meanings that it acquired at those two moments. Montesquieu praised Jews for forging new credit instruments that benefited everyone because he assumed that Jews inhabited a society of status that kept them in a subordinate position. When equality emerged later in the century as a concrete and, for some, desirable possibility, Jewish commercial and financial dexterity was once again perceived as a threat rather than a boon to state and society. On the eve of the Revolution, both friends and enemies of Jews depicted them as burning with the desire to extract excessive profits from Christians, even as they differed about whether any remedy for this moral failing was possible.

本章围绕两个时刻展开：1740 年代孟德斯鸠对犹太人发明汇票的传说意义的重塑，以及本世纪最后 25 年发生的关于解放的辩论。我认为，这个传说被唤起的话语和政治背景说明了它在这两个时刻所获得的截然不同的含义。孟德斯鸠称赞犹太人创造了新的信贷工具，使每个人都受益，因为他认为犹太人居住在一个使他们处于从属地位的地位社会中。当平等在本世纪晚些时候作为一种具体的、对某些人来说是理想的可能性出现时，犹太人的商业和金融灵活性再次被视为对国家和社会的威胁，而不是一种福音。在大革命前夕，犹太人的朋友和敌人都把他们描绘成从基督徒身上榨取超额利润的强烈愿望，即使他们对这种道德失败是否有可能得到补救存在分歧。

While Montesquieu drew a sharp line between commercial credit and usury, the two were conflated once again during the emancipation debates, as they had been in Cleirac’s commentary. The prospect of legal equality once again made Jews an emblem of the disruptive character of credit, and particularly of oligopolies. Baptism had rendered Jewishness invisible in societies that prized clearly demarcated religious boundaries. Citizenship now rendered Jews legally indistinguishable in a political and economic order that proclaimed its preference for individualism over corporatism but in fact remained wary of the leveling of differences it had produced.

虽然孟德斯鸠在商业信贷和高利贷之间划出了一条鲜明的界限，但在解放的辩论中，这两者再次被混为一谈，就像在克莱拉克的评论中那样。法律平等的前景再次使犹太人成为信贷，特别是寡头垄断的破坏性特征的象征。洗礼使犹太人在重视明确划分宗教界限的社会中变得不可见。现在，公民身份使犹太人在法律上无法区分，这种政治和经济秩序宣称其倾向于个人主义而非公司主义，但事实上对它所产生的差异的平坦化保持着警惕。

Because of the scope of my inquiry, I focus on Christian representations of Jewish economic roles, with a nod to the responses that they elicited from a few Jewish writers and community leaders.8 I show that eighteenth-century Christian views of Jewish commerce and usury developed at the intersection of discursive traditions and the lived experience of different Jewish communities in France. Montesquieu’s positive characterization of Jewish commerce owed at least something to the more inclusive Bordelais context. His more generous disposition did not endure once it was transplanted into a different time and place a quarter century later. At this time, acrimonious debates about the civic and political status of Jews broke out not in and around Bordeaux, but in the northeastern regions of France, where masses of poor Jews and a few wealthy moneylenders and army contractors were regarded by the Christian population as exploitative usurers. The economic side of the emancipation debates thus brings to the fore yet another configuration of a Christian discourse in which Jews symbolized the hidden dangers of credit markets in which contractual equality masked an a priori power differential between economic actors.

由于我的调查范围，我把重点放在基督教对犹太人经济角色的表述上，并对这些表述从一些犹太作家和社区领袖那里引起的反应进行点拨。8我表明，十八世纪基督教对犹太商业和高利贷的看法是在法国不同犹太社区的话语传统和生活经验的交汇处发展起来的。孟德斯鸠对犹太商业的正面描述至少要归功于更具包容性的波德莱环境。四分之一世纪后，当他被移植到一个不同的时间和地点时，他更慷慨的态度并没有持续下去。此时，关于犹太人的公民和政治地位的激烈争论不是在波尔多及其周边地区爆发的，而是在法国东北部地区，在那里，大量贫穷的犹太人和少数富有的放债人和军队承包商被基督教居民视为剥削性的高利贷者。因此，解放辩论的经济方面使基督教话语的另一种配置凸显出来，在这种话语中，犹太人象征着信贷市场的隐患，在这种情况下，合同的平等性掩盖了经济行为人之间先验的权力差异。

The Second Moment of Discontinuity (1748): Montesquieu

不连续的第二时刻》（1748）。孟德斯鸠

Two books of Montesquieu’s Spirit of the Laws were devoted to commerce, and one to money. Additional reflections about how the economy intersected with politics, society, and culture peppered the entire work. Book XXI described the history of commerce from antiquity to the (then) present. A climactic turning point appeared in chapter 20, which bore the dramatic title “How Commerce Broke Through the Barbarism of Europe” (“Comment le commerce se fit hour en Europe à travers la barbarie”) and traced the waning of medieval anti-usury sentiments and the rise of l’esprit de commerce (“the spirit of commerce”). Around the time of Europe’s first transoceanic voyages, Montesquieu wrote, commerce ceased to be “the profession only of mean persons,” and thus the exclusive province of “a nation covered with infamy” (by which he meant Jews), and “re-entered . . . the bosom of probity.”9 In this account, Jews were the frontrunners in the transformation of commerce from a despised occupation associated with usury and moneylending to a dignified and valuable activity. In this way they spearheaded a veritable political and cultural revolution through which commerce, for the first time, “became capable of eluding violence ” (XXI, 20, my emphasis). (I draw attention to the words “eluding violence ” because in the course of the chapter, we will see that they played a particularly important rhetorical function.)

孟德斯鸠的《法律的精神》中有两本书专门论述商业，还有一本论述货币。关于经济如何与政治、社会和文化交织在一起的其他思考在整部作品中随处可见。第二十一册描述了从古代到（当时）现在的商业历史。一个高潮转折点出现在第 20 章，该章以 “商业如何突破欧洲的野蛮”（“Comment le commerce se fit hour en Europe à travers la barbarie”）为戏剧性标题，追溯了中世纪反高利贷情绪的消退和商业精神的崛起。孟德斯鸠写道，大约在欧洲第一次跨洋航行的时候，商业不再是 “只有卑鄙的人才能从事的职业”，因此也不再是 “一个沾满耻辱的民族”（他指的是犹太人）的专利，而是 “重新进入了…… 正直的怀抱”。9在这种说法中，犹太人是将商业从一种与高利贷和放债有关的被鄙视的职业转变为一种有尊严和有价值的活动的先锋。通过这种方式，他们带头进行了一场名副其实的政治和文化革命，通过这场革命，商业第一次 “能够避开暴力”（XXI，20，我强调）。（我提请注意 “躲避暴力” 这几个字，因为在本章中，我们将看到它们发挥了特别重要的修辞功能。）

How were Jews able to engineer such a monumental transformation and bequeath to Europe a modern, safe, and secular commercial society? To this complex question, Montesquieu gave a deceptively simple answer: “The Jews invented letters of exchange” (XXI, 20). Scores of scholars, many imbued with great learning, have read this statement, yet very few have reflected on its meaning. Studies of Montesquieu have generally glossed over it.10 There are various reasons for this neglect: the relative marginality of Jews and Judaism in Montesquieu’s thought, a general disregard for these themes among mainstream scholars of the French Enlightenment, and a deep investment in the irenic and inclusive quality of doux commerce .11 Even specialists of Montesquieu’s economic thought normally treat his mystifying statement as a self-evident assertion that requires little more than some paraphrasing. They spend more time on other subjects, such as Montesquieu’s opposition to the nobility’s involvement in trade, his critique of mercantilism (“jalousie sur le commerce”), his preference for commercial over territorial empires, and his contrast between “commerce de luxe” (which he regarded as typical of monarchies) and “commerce d’économie” (a feature of republics). Those who cite Montesquieu’s passage about the Jewish invention of bills of exchange, regardless of their ideological tendencies, do so incidentally or without inquiring into its sources.12

犹太人是如何实现如此巨大的转变，并为欧洲留下一个现代、安全和世俗的商业社会的？对于这个复杂的问题，孟德斯鸠给出了一个貌似简单的答案。“犹太人发明了交换信”（XXI，20）。数十位学者，其中许多人都有渊博的学识，都读过这句话，但很少有人对其含义进行思考。对孟德斯鸠的研究一般都对它一笔带过。10这种忽视有各种原因：犹太人和犹太教在孟德斯鸠思想中的相对边缘化，法国启蒙运动的主流学者对这些主题的普遍漠视，以及对温和商业（doux commerce）的友好和包容品质的深刻投资。11即使是研究孟德斯鸠经济思想的专家，通常也会把他的神秘说法当作不言而喻的论断，只需要进行一些转述即可。他们把更多的时间花在其他方面，如孟德斯鸠反对贵族参与贸易，他对重商主义的批判（“jalousie sur le commerce”），他对商业帝国而不是领土帝国的偏好，以及他对 “奢侈的商业”（他认为这是君主制的典型）和 “经济的商业”（共和国的特征）的对比。那些引用孟德斯鸠关于犹太人发明汇票的段落的人，不管他们的意识形态倾向如何，都是偶然地或没有探究其来源。12

One name stands out in this scholarly landscape: that of Albert Hirschman, the first modern critic to draw attention to Montesquieu’s claim about the Jewish invention of bills of exchange and to make it a cornerstone of his reading of The Spirit of the Laws as a case for commerce as a check on despotism and unbridled passions.13 By virtue of his own biography, Hirschman may have been more predisposed than others to recognize the pride of place that, uncharacteristically for his time, Montesquieu assigned to Jews in his narrative of the civilizing process. Yet even Hirschman displays little interest in probing the provenance of Montesquieu’s statement about the Jewish invention of bills of exchange or the reception it may have had. Rather, he uses it to support his strikingly original reading of The Spirit of the Laws , which emphasizes the nexus between anti-authoritarian politics and commerce as a prefiguration of the interdependence of democracy and capitalism.

在这一学术格局中，有一个名字非常突出：阿尔伯特·赫希曼（Albert Hirschman），他是第一个提请注意孟德斯鸠关于犹太人发明汇票的说法的现代批评家，并将其作为他解读《法律的精神》的基石，认为商业是对专制主义和无节制激情的一种制约。13由于他自己的传记，赫希曼可能比其他人更倾向于认识到孟德斯鸠一反常态地在他的时代赋予犹太人在其文明进程叙述中的骄傲地位。然而，即使是赫希曼，也对探究孟德斯鸠关于犹太人发明汇票的说法的出处或其可能产生的影响表现得兴趣不大。相反，他用它来支持他对《法律的精神》的惊人的原创性解读，即强调反权威政治和商业之间的联系，作为民主和资本主义相互依存的预示。

The evidence uncovered in this chapter will question this reading. For now, as further testament to the divergent patterns of French and Jewish historiography, we may note that Montesquieu’s passage relaying the legend of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange has drawn more attention from historians of early modern Jews, who treat it as evidence that Montesquieu was one of the few eighteenth-century French philosophes sympathetic to Jews, than from scholars in any other field.14 When, in 1968, Arthur Hertzberg made the controversial case for the Enlightenment roots of modern antisemitism, he also singled out Montesquieu as a skeptical anti-Voltaire, a philosophe benignly predisposed toward Jews.15 Subsequent studies of the French Enlightenment’s engagement with Jews and Judaism have taken issue with Hertzberg’s portrait and offered more nuanced interpretations of it, but these works have also contributed little to our understanding of Montesquieu’s view of the relationship between Jews and the spirit of commerce.16

本章所揭示的证据将对这种解读提出质疑。现在，作为法国和犹太历史学不同模式的进一步证明，我们可以注意到，孟德斯鸠转述犹太人发明汇票的传说的段落引起了早期现代犹太人历史学家的更多关注，他们将其视为孟德斯鸠是十八世纪法国少数同情犹太人的哲学家之一的证据，而不是来自任何其他领域的学者。141968 年，当阿瑟·赫兹伯格为现代反犹太主义的启蒙运动根源提出有争议的论点时，他还特别指出孟德斯鸠是一个持怀疑态度的反伏尔泰，一个对犹太人有善意倾向的哲学家。15随后关于法国启蒙运动与犹太人和犹太教的研究对赫兹伯格的描述提出了异议，并对其进行了更细致的解释，但这些作品也，对我们了解孟德斯鸠对犹太人和商业精神之间关系的看法没有什么贡献。16

In modern critical scholarship, therefore, Montesquieu’s contention that “Jews invented letters of exchange” is treated alternately as too obvious or too enigmatic to engage. By now, however, we know that these words contain more than meets the eye and that they would not have passed unnoticed at the time. The footnote that Montesquieu added in support of his assertion will ring all too familiar to readers of this book: “It is known that under Philip Augustus and Philip the Tall, the Jews who were chased from France took refuge in Lombardy, and that there they gave to foreign merchants and travellers secret letters, drawn upon those to whom they had intrusted their effects in France, which were accepted” (XX, 20, note o ). By introducing his corroborating evidence with the turn of phrase “it is known,” Montesquieu was not merely adopting a common rhetorical device. The legend, we now realize, had been in circulation for a whole century when he reiterated it. While the prevailing standards for attribution at the time did not demand that he offer a bibliographical reference, it is clear that Us et coustumes de la mer and Le parfait négociant provided Montesquieu with the gist of the story.17 And yet the spin he gave to it was utterly new.

因此，在现代批判性的学术研究中，孟德斯鸠关于 “犹太人发明了交换信” 的论点被交替地视为过于明显或过于神秘而无法参与。然而，现在我们知道，这些话所包含的内容比我们看到的要多，而且它们在当时不会不被注意到。孟德斯鸠为支持其论断而添加的脚注对本书的读者来说再熟悉不过了。“众所周知，在菲利普·奥古斯都和菲利普大帝时期，被赶出法国的犹太人在伦巴第避难，他们在那里向外国商人和旅行者提供密函，这些密函是以他们在法国托付物品的人为对象的，并被接受”（XX，20，注o）。孟德斯鸠用 “众所周知” 这个短语来介绍他的确凿证据，这不仅仅是采用了一种常见的修辞手法。我们现在意识到，当他重申这个传说时，它已经流传了整整一个世纪。虽然当时通行的归属标准并没有要求他提供书目参考，但很明显，《海洋的用途和习俗》和《优秀商人》（Le parfait négociant）为孟德斯鸠提供了这个故事的要点。17然而，他对这个故事所做的修改是完全新的。

The Spirit of the Laws introduced the second moment of discontinuity in the legend’s reception, one that was more disruptive than Dupuis de la Serra’s refutation of its credibility (chapter 5 ). Attention-grabbing stories and influential authors are a combustive mix, no less so when the stories are specious. Montesquieu lent his authority to the legend of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange, but he also altered its meaning. Gone were the didactic aims of Cleirac and Savary, intended to draw a line between shady speculators and upright merchants. By inventing bills of exchange, Montesquieu posited, Jews introduced new dynamism into Europe’s economy and became harbingers of modernity. By devising a credit instrument that enabled them to outsmart their oppressors, they resisted persecution and curbed the reach of despotism. Thanks to these bills, “commerce . . . became capable of eluding violence . . . ; the richest merchant having none but invisible effects, which he could convey imperceptibly everywhere he pleased” (XXI, 20, my emphasis).18

《法律的精神》引入了传奇接受过程中的第二个不连续时刻，这个时刻比杜普伊·德拉·塞拉对其可信度的反驳更具破坏性（第五章）。吸引眼球的故事和有影响力的作者是一种混合体，当故事似是而非时也是如此。孟德斯鸠为犹太人发明汇票的传说赋予了他的权威，但他也改变了其含义。克莱拉克和萨瓦利（Savary）的说教目的消失了，他们的目的是在黑心的投机者和正直的商人之间划清界限。孟德斯鸠认为，通过发明汇票，犹太人为欧洲的经济带来了新的活力，并成为现代性的预言家。通过设计一种使他们能够胜过压迫者的信贷工具，他们抵制了迫害，遏制了专制主义的影响。由于这些票据，“商业…… 变得能够躲避暴力…… 最富有的商人没有任何东西，只有无形的效果，他可以不知不觉地把这些东西带到他喜欢的任何地方”（XXI，20，我的强调）。18

A putatively Jewish invention, we are told, engineered a cultural and political revolution that altered the course of European history. A despot, perhaps seeking to placate popular anti-Jewish sentiments, might have been tempted to confiscate land, homes, ingots, or cargoes, but not pieces of paper that he could not redeem. Once limited in their ability to plunder, princes realized that they “should govern with more prudence than they themselves could ever have imagined”; thus might Europe “be cured of Machiavelism” (XX, 20). Meanwhile, the church, which equated commerce with “knavery,” lost its grip on society and “the Theologians were obliged to limit their principles” (XXI, 20). With the rise of the spirit of commerce, moderation triumphed in the spheres of government and social mores: “Happy is it for men that they are in a situation in which, though their passions prompted them to be wicked, it is, nevertheless, to their interest to be humane and virtuous” (XXI, 20).

我们被告知，一个被认为是犹太人的发明，策划了一场改变欧洲历史进程的文化和政治革命。一个暴君，也许是为了安抚民众的反犹太情绪，可能会被诱惑去没收土地、房屋、钱币或货物，但不会没收他无法赎回的纸片。一旦他们的掠夺能力受到限制，王子们就会意识到，他们 “应该以比他们自己所能想象的更谨慎的方式进行治理”；这样，欧洲就可能 “被治愈马基雅维主义”（XX，20）。同时，将商业等同于 “奴役” 的教会失去了对社会的控制，“神学家们不得不限制他们的原则”（XXI，20）。随着商业精神的兴起，在政府和社会习俗领域，温和的态度取得了胜利。“人是幸福的，因为他们处于这样一种境地，虽然他们的激情促使他们作恶，但对他们的利益来说，做一个有人情味的人和有道德的人”（二十一，20）。

Montesquieu’s account of the emergence of commercial society in this chapter of The Spirit of the Laws proved extremely influential in France and abroad in two primary ways. First, it provided the most authoritative rendition of the theory of doux commerce , which supporters repeated over and over and critics derided no less insistently. The chapter was in many respects a rebuttal of The Adventures of Thelemachus (1699), a novel written by the Archbishop of Cambrai, François de Salignac de La Mothe-Fénelon, that has been deemed “the most read literary work in eighteenth-century France (after the Bible).”19 Montesquieu shared with Fénelon a disdain for the Machiavellianism of Louis XIV and his entourage but lacked Fénelon’s nostalgia for ancient agrarian republicanism. Second, The Spirit of the Laws outlined a chronology of European history that gained enormous traction, pitting a dark medieval past against the increasing progress of what today we call the early modern period. Montesquieu did not dwell on precise dates (his reference to Philip Augustus and Philip the Tall would place the invention of bills of exchange between 1180 and 1322, while the gist of his narrative clearly postpones it to a later moment), but the picture he painted leaves no doubt that he viewed the Middle Ages as a period dominated by the barbarian invasions, Scholasticism, economic stagnation, and tyrannical rulers. An enemy of the Roman Church, he portrayed medieval Catholic doctrine as hostile to all profit-seeking enterprises. Needless to say, this picture left a deep mark on scholarly and popular understanding of both the Middle Ages and the Jewish past.

孟德斯鸠在《法律的精神》的这一章中对商业社会的出现进行了阐述，在法国和国外有两个主要方面的影响。首先，它对 “商业欺诈” 的理论进行了最权威的诠释，支持者一再重复这一理论，而批评者也同样坚持不懈地对其进行嘲笑。这一章在很多方面都是对《忒勒马科斯历险记》（1699）的反驳，该小说由康布雷大主教弗朗索瓦·德·萨利尼亚克·德·拉莫特·费内隆撰写，被认为是 “十八世纪法国阅读量最大的文学作品（仅次于圣经）”。19孟德斯鸠与费纳隆一样，对路易十四及其随从的马基雅维利主义不屑一顾，但缺乏费纳隆对古代农业共和主义的怀念。第二，《法律的精神》勾勒出了一个获得巨大吸引力的欧洲历史年表，将黑暗的中世纪历史与今天我们称之为早期现代时期的不断进步对立起来。孟德斯鸠没有纠缠于精确的日期（他提到的菲利普·奥古斯都和菲利普·泰尔会把汇票的发明放在 1180 年和 1322 年之间，而他叙述的要点显然把它推迟到了更晚的时刻），但他描绘的画面毫无疑问地表明，他认为中世纪是一个由野蛮人入侵、学术主义、经济停滞和暴虐的统治者主导的时期。作为罗马教会的敌人，他把中世纪的天主教教义描绘成对所有追求利润的企业的敌视。不用说，这幅画在学术界和大众对中世纪和犹太历史的理解上都留下了深刻的印记。

With no small touch of irony, Montesquieu placed Jews at the center of his narrative of the triumph of the spirit of commerce over medieval Christian obscurantism. For Cleirac 100 years earlier, the supposedly historical account of how Jews devised marine insurance and bills of exchange to protect their assets forged a link between medieval usury and seventeenth-century commercial credit. For Montesquieu, who glorified commercial credit, bills of exchange became the antithesis to, rather than the sequel of, the pawnshop. As such, after the publication of The Spirit of the Laws , they began to figure alongside the three great inventions of the printing press, the compass, and firearms that, following Francis Bacon, were said to have made the modern world.20 Proponents of the Napoleonic Code of Commerce would later describe the invention of bills of exchange, whether by Jews or by Florentines, as “comparable to the discovery of the compass and of America.”21 Opponents of Montesquieu’s thought were even quicker to seize on his words. The Sorbonne theologians found the entire chapter in which they appeared so scandalous that they demanded its expurgation. At issue was both Montesquieu’s disparagement of medieval church views of the economy and his casting of Jews not just in a positive light, but as dei ex machina behind the creation of a new European commercial society in which credit flowed freely, secure from government prying.22

孟德斯鸠不无讽刺地将犹太人置于他关于商业精神战胜中世纪基督教蒙昧主义的叙述的中心。对于 100 年前的克莱拉克来说，犹太人如何设计海事保险和汇票来保护他们的资产的所谓历史叙述，在中世纪的高利贷和 17 世纪的商业信贷之间建立了联系。对于美化商业信贷的孟德斯鸠来说，汇票成为典当行的对立面，而不是典当行的延续。因此，在《法律的精神》出版后，它们开始与印刷术、指南针和枪支这三项伟大的发明并列，继弗朗西斯·培根之后，据说这三项发明创造了现代世界。20《拿破仑商法典》的支持者后来将汇票的发明，无论是犹太人还是佛罗伦萨人的发明，描述为 “可与指南针和美洲的发现相媲美”。21孟德斯鸠思想的反对者甚至更快地抓住了他的话。索邦大学的神学家们发现，这些话出现在整个章节中是如此的可耻，他们要求对其进行删减。问题在于，孟德斯鸠贬低了中世纪教会对经济的看法，而且他对犹太人的描述不仅是正面的，而且是创造一个新的欧洲商业社会的幕后推手，在这个社会中，信贷自由流动，不受政府窥探。22

Montesquieu’s rendition of the oft-repeated legend of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange must have appeared as novel to eighteenth-century readers as Machiavelli’s nonreligious definition of virtù had appeared to readers of The Prince 200 years earlier. Jews, however, were incidental to Montesquieu’s valorization of the spirit of commerce, and they remained so in all other arguments in which he deployed them. In 1723, two years after the appearance, to great acclaim, of the Persian Letters , the Jews of Bordeaux were officially allowed to practice their religion. There is no doubt that Montesquieu was acquainted with some of these individuals and met other Jews during his travels.23 In the three-quarters of a century that followed the publication of Cleirac’s Us et coustumes de la mer , fears of religious dissimulation continued to haunt Catholic believers, but crypto-Judaism in reality progressively declined. During the years that Montesquieu served in the city’s parlement (1716–1726), Jews “were coming into the open,” ceasing to marry in church or baptize their children.24 Meanwhile, Bordeaux became France’s chief Atlantic port together with Nantes and one of Europe’s main commercial hubs. There, New Christians and New Jews, alongside native Catholic and Huguenot merchants and resident Dutch, English, and Hamburgers, built large commercial houses and the most well-to-do absorbed the rentiers ’ habits of conspicuous consumption.25 These merchants of various religions and confessions endorsed each other’s bills of exchange and underwrote each other’s marine insurance as a matter of course.26

孟德斯鸠对犹太人发明汇票这一经常重复的传说的演绎，对 18 世纪的读者来说，一定显得很新奇，就像 200 年前马基雅弗利对美德的非宗教定义对《君主论》的读者一样。然而，在孟德斯鸠对商业精神的评价中，犹太人是附带的，而且在他部署犹太人的所有其他论证中，他们仍然如此。1723 年，在《波斯信札》问世两年后，波尔多的犹太人被正式允许信奉他们的宗教。毫无疑问，孟德斯鸠与其中一些人相识，并在他的旅行中遇到了其他犹太人。23在克莱拉克的《海洋的用途和习俗》出版后的四分之三个世纪里，对宗教异化的恐惧继续困扰着天主教信徒，但现实中的隐性犹太教却逐渐衰落。在孟德斯鸠在该市议会任职的几年里（1716-1726），犹太人 “逐渐公开化”，不再在教堂里结婚，也不再给他们的孩子施洗。24与此同时，波尔多与南特一起成为法国的主要大西洋港口，也是欧洲的主要商业中心之一。在那里，新基督徒和新犹太人与当地的天主教和胡格诺商人以及居住在那里的荷兰人、英国人和汉堡人一起，建造了大型商业房屋，最富裕的人吸收了租界人士的显性消费习惯。25这些不同宗教和信仰的商人相互背书，并理所当然地为对方的海事保险提供担保。26

Without reducing the novelty of Montesquieu’s version of the legend to a reflection of this reality, we can still suspect that the important economic roles played by Jewish merchants in his native Gascony and the social standing that some of them achieved influenced his views. However, his version of the legend did not signal an all-embracing appreciation of Jews by either Montesquieu or his followers. Unlike Voltaire, whom Ronald Schechter has described as “obsessed with the Jews,” Montesquieu had only a side interest in the subject.27 But like Voltaire and other philosophes, from time to time, Montesquieu, too, drew from his understanding of Jewish history and religious books to marshal anecdotes in the service of his critique of European history and culture. Using a technique already tested in the Persian Letters , Montesquieu in The Spirit of the Laws put his harshest indictment of the Iberian inquisitions in the mouth of an imaginary Portuguese Jew who allegedly witnessed the burning at the stake of “an eighteenth-year-old Jewess” in Lisbon (XXV, 13).28

如果不把孟德斯鸠版本的传奇故事的新颖性归结为对这一现实的反映，我们仍然可以怀疑，犹太商人在他的家乡加斯科尼扮演的重要经济角色以及他们中的一些人取得的社会地位影响了他的观点。然而，他的传说版本并不意味着孟德斯鸠或其追随者对犹太人的全面赞赏。与伏尔泰不同，孟德斯鸠只是对这个问题有一点兴趣，罗纳德·谢赫特（Ronald Schechter）曾将其描述为 “对犹太人的痴迷”。27但是，像伏尔泰和其他哲学家一样，孟德斯鸠也不时地从他对犹太历史和宗教书籍的理解中汲取营养，为他对欧洲历史和文化的批判提供轶事线索。孟德斯鸠在《法律的精神》中使用了一种已经在《波斯信札》中测试过的技巧，把他对伊比利亚审问的最严厉的控诉放在了一个想象中的葡萄牙犹太人的口中，据说他目睹了里斯本 “一个 18 岁的女犹太人” 被烧死在火刑柱上（XXV, 13）。28

Aside from this well-known vignette, references to Jews in The Spirit of the Laws are few and far between, if generally sympathetic. The ancient Israelites, following Josephus, are said to have been an agricultural nation, the opposite of the Phoenicians (XXI, 6)—an argument that Christian reformers would deploy later in the century as evidence of the possibility of “regenerating” a people that had not always devoted itself to usury.29 In only one other instance did Montesquieu refer to the plight of Jews as evidence that commerce was incompatible with despotism. In Russia, he wrote, all subjects of the empire were forbidden from conducting any import and export trade, and the expulsion of Jews in 1745 followed accusations that they were smuggling money out of the country and to those banished to Siberia by means of bills of exchange (XXII, 14). Blind despotism, Montesquieu intimated, was a cause of economic underdevelopment.

除了这个著名的小插曲外，《法律的精神》中提到犹太人的地方很少，即使是一般的同情心。根据约瑟夫的说法，古代以色列人是一个农业民族，与腓尼基人相反（二十一，6） —— 基督教改革者在本世纪晚些时候将这一论点作为 “再生” 的可能性的证据，这个民族并不总是专注于高利贷。29孟德斯鸠只在另一个例子中提到了犹太人的困境，作为商业与专制主义不相容的证据。他写道，在俄罗斯，帝国的所有臣民都被禁止进行任何进出口贸易，1745 年驱逐犹太人时，有人指责他们将钱偷运出国，并通过汇票的方式将钱流放到西伯利亚（XXII，14）。孟德斯鸠暗示，盲目的专制主义是经济不发达的一个原因。

The evaluation of Jews’ economic functions across Montesquieu’s works is not consistent. The Persian Letters indulged in stereotypes about Jews’ unchanging nature and avarice while also praising their diminishing persecution in Europe.30 In addition to containing conflicting judgments, Montesquieu’s oeuvre is also full of missed opportunities. The relationship between commerce and toleration is never discussed specifically with respect to Jews. Some of the most oft-quoted lines from The Spirit of the Laws are emblematic of the theory of doux commerce : “Commerce is a cure for the most destructive prejudices; for it is almost a general rule, that wherever we find agreeable manners, there commerce flourishes; and wherever there is commerce, there we meet with agreeable manners” (XX, 1). The phrasing is powerful and the thesis famous, but readers are left guessing who the victims of these “destructive prejudices” are and how exactly self-interest curbs those prejudices. Allusions make room for expansive and ideologically laden readings.31

在孟德斯鸠的作品中，对犹太人的经济功能的评价并不一致。波斯书信》沉溺于对犹太人不变的本性和贪婪的刻板印象，同时也赞扬他们在欧洲受到的迫害越来越小。30除了包含相互矛盾的判断外，孟德斯鸠的作品中也充满了错失的机会。商业和宽容之间的关系从未专门针对犹太人进行讨论。《法律的精神》中最常被引用的一些句子体现了 “商业” 的理论：“商业是治疗最具破坏性的偏见的良药；因为这几乎是一条通则，凡是我们发现合意的礼仪的地方，商业就会繁荣；凡是有商业的地方，我们就会遇到合意的礼仪”（XX, 1）。这句话很有力，论点也很有名，但读者只能猜测这些 “破坏性偏见” 的受害者是谁，以及自我利益究竟如何抑制这些偏见。典故为扩张性的、带有意识形态色彩的解读提供了空间。31

Alongside its admiration for the effects of commerce, The Spirit of the Laws also registered certain qualms. Elaborating on a motif then in wide circulation, Montesquieu expressed no doubt that “the history of commerce is that of the communication of people” (XXI, 5). But commerce could also tear apart the social fabric, he noted: mercantile societies often lacked hospitality, asking monetary compensation for what used to be offered for free (XX, 2). An astute observer and privileged nobleman, Montesquieu expressed his staunch opposition to the noblesse commerçante for both political and ethical reasons (V, 8; XX, 21–22). “Commerce,” he pronounced resolutely, “is the profession of equal people” (V, 8).32 Fully immersed in the society of orders of his time, Montesquieu embraced a concept of equality that meant equality of rank, rather than wealth. Merchants’ fortunes, as he realized, could vary enormously. But even more than the nobility’s oligopolistic position, he abhorred the idea that commerce might erode traditional hierarchies and aristocratic honor.

除了对商业效果的赞美之外，《法律的精神》还记录了一些疑虑。孟德斯鸠在阐述当时广泛流传的一个主题时表示，“商业的历史就是人们交流的历史”（XXI，5），这是毫无疑问的。但他指出，商业也可能撕裂社会结构：商业社会往往缺乏热情，要求对过去免费提供的东西进行货币补偿（XX，2）。作为一个敏锐的观察家和享有特权的贵族，孟德斯鸠出于政治和道德的原因，表达了对商业贵族的坚决反对（V，8；XX，21-22）。他坚决地说：商业，“是平等的人的职业”（V，8）。32完全沉浸在他那个时代的秩序社会中，孟德斯鸠接受了一种平等的概念，这意味着等级的平等，而不是财富的平等。他意识到，商人的财富可以有很大的差别。但比起贵族的寡头垄断地位，他更痛恨商业可能侵蚀传统等级制度和贵族荣誉的想法。

Departing from more conventional interpretations, some scholars insist that Montesquieu feared both the excesses of consumption and “the spirit of extreme equality” into which democracy could degenerate (VIII, 2).33 This is also how certain noblemen read Montesquieu at the time. In a petition addressed to Marseilles’ city government, the nobility of the sword, which had been excluded from power in favor of the local commercial elite in 1660, demanded reinstatement in the municipal council, noting that, as “the author of the Spirit of the Laws has written, ‘in countries where people are moved solely by the spirit of commerce, they sacrifice everything humane, all moral virtues.’”34 This is a fair citation of passages that are not normally highlighted in modern scholarship on Montesquieu, which tends to stress the positive rather than the detrimental consequences of the spirit of commerce.

与更多的传统解释不同，一些学者坚持认为，孟德斯鸠既担心消费的过度，也担心民主可能堕落的 “极端平等精神”（VIII，2）。33这也是当时某些贵族对孟德斯鸠的解读。在一份写给马赛市政府的请愿书中，1660 年被排除在权力之外而有利于当地商业精英的剑客贵族们要求恢复在市政委员会中的地位，他们指出，正如 《法律的精神》的作者所写的那样，“在人们完全被商业精神所驱动的国家，他们牺牲了一切人性，一切道德的美德”。34这是一个公平的引用，在关于孟德斯鸠的现代学术研究中，这些段落通常不被强调，因为现代学术研究倾向于强调商业精神的积极而非有害的后果。

Where does all this leave us with regard to the Jews? Did Montesquieu conceive of those in his own Bordeaux as “equal people” within commercial society even if, for example, they were barred from leadership positions in the city’s Chamber of Commerce? And in his view, did Sephardic merchants, like all Jews allegedly, “display for their religion an obstinate, invincible loyalty which borders on fanaticism,” or were they full participants in “the communication of people”?35 Montesquieu never pursued these questions because, as even an admirer of his views on Jews admitted, he “was fundamentally not interested in Jews as such, but only to the extent that they provided him startling examples of the relationship between intolerance and proselytism.”36 In this indifference, Montesquieu was hardly alone. Voltaire was only the most eloquent of the philosophes who invoked Jews for the purpose of making abstract pronouncements about commerce as an engine of religious toleration, in spite of his antipathy toward Jews and Judaism. His Lettres philosophiques of 1734 contained an iconic description of the London Royal Exchange as a place where “representatives of all nations gather for the utility of mankind; there, the Jew, the Mohammedan and the Christian behave towards each other as if they were of the same religion, and reserve the word ‘infidel’ for those who go bankrupt.”37

这一切让我们对犹太人的看法是什么？孟德斯鸠是否认为他自己的波尔多的犹太人在商业社会中是 “平等的人”，即使他们被禁止在该市的商会中担任领导职务？在他看来，塞法尔德商人是否像所有犹太人一样，“对他们的宗教表现出一种顽固的、不可战胜的、近乎狂热的忠诚”，或者他们是 “人民交流” 的完全参与者？35孟德斯鸠从未追问过这些问题，因为即使是他对犹太人的看法的崇拜者也承认，他 “从根本上说对犹太人本身并不感兴趣，只是在他们为他提供了关于不容忍和改宗之间关系的惊人例子的情况下”。36在这种冷漠中，孟德斯鸠并不孤单。伏尔泰只是最善于引用犹太人的哲学家之一，尽管他对犹太人和犹太教怀有反感，但他还是抽象地宣称商业是宗教宽容的动力。他在 1734 年的《哲学信件》（Lettres philosophiques）中对伦敦皇家交易所进行了标志性的描述，“所有国家的代表为了人类的利益聚集在一起；在那里，犹太人、穆罕默德人和基督徒相互之间的行为就像他们属于同一个宗教一样，并将 ‘异教徒’ 一词留给那些破产的人”。37

Literary critic Erich Auerbach, writing in exile from Nazi Germany, noted that Voltaire’s vignette “was not really written for a realistic purpose,” but rather “to insinuate certain ideas” about the subordination of religious belonging to the logic of the market.38 Others have since identified earlier Dutch and English variants of this cameo.39 In the same vein, Montesquieu’s rendering of the legend of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange was more concerned with offering a vivid critique of despotism and the Catholic Church than engaging with the actual status of Jewish merchants or interrogating the role of commerce in Jewish history. The moral of his tale was thus bounded by a political order that made no space for equal rights for Jews.

文学评论家埃里希·奥尔巴赫（Erich Auerbach）在流亡纳粹德国时写道，伏尔泰的小品 “其实不是为了现实的目的而写的”，而是 “为了暗示某些想法”，即宗教归属感从属于市场的逻辑。38此后，其他人发现了这幅浮雕在早期的荷兰和英国的变体。39同样，孟德斯鸠对犹太人发明汇票的传说的渲染，更多的是对专制主义和天主教会进行生动的批判，而不是涉及犹太商人的实际地位或对商业在犹太历史中的作用进行质疑。因此，他的故事的寓意受到政治秩序的约束，没有为犹太人提供平等权利的空间。

Phase III (1748–1775): Bifurcation

第三阶段（1748-1775）：分岔期

In the aftermath of The Spirit of the Laws , the legend’s textual transmission split along two paths. Some authors absorbed Montesquieu’s interpretation of the alleged Jewish role in propelling the development of a commercial society in which bills of exchange linked merchants together in defiance of despotic rulers. Others followed in the footsteps of Cleirac and Savary, portraying Jews as having invented an instrument that allowed ill-intentioned merchants to accumulate wealth by duplicitous means. A boom in serial publications and an expansion of the reading public facilitated the diffusion of both strands of this story, which occasionally merged in surprising ways.

在《法律的精神》之后，该传说的文本传播沿着两条道路分裂。一些作者吸收了孟德斯鸠对所谓犹太人在推动商业社会发展中的作用的解释，在商业社会中，汇票将商人们联系在一起，对抗专制的统治者。其他人则追随克莱拉克和萨瓦里的脚步，把犹太人描绘成发明了一种工具，让心怀不轨的商人通过欺骗手段积累财富。连载出版物的繁荣和阅读人群的扩大促进了这一故事的两股力量的传播，它们有时会以惊人的方式融合在一起。

Diderot and D’Alembert’s Encyclopédie illustrates all these trends vividly. With some 74,000 entries written by more than 130 contributors, this grand intellectual project inevitably fell short of consistency. In the Encyclopédie the legend appeared in reference to both marine insurance and bills of exchange, in both abbreviated and extended form, and sometimes accompanied by an endorsement and other times by doubts or revisions.40 Among the entries that mentioned the legend, two relied mostly on Montesquieu and one primarily on Cleirac and Savary. The entry for “Lettre de change,” authored by Antoine-Gaspard Boucher d’Argis, a noted lawyer whose writings were used in the failed attempt to exonerate the Huguenot merchant Jean Calas in an infamous trial in 1762, borrowed from both Us et coustumes de la mer and Le parfaitnégociant , lifting entire sections from each. Boucher d’Argis raised questions about the legend’s truthfulness, but in the end he did not embrace the objections proffered by Dupuis de la Serra about the narrative’s plausibility. Instead, after acknowledging the inconsistencies in the historical account of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange, he concluded: “It would nonetheless be difficult to imagine that the Jews did not take any precautions to salvage their goods when fleeing to Lombardy—something that could only be accomplished by means of bills of exchange. Therefore, there are reasons to believe that they were the first inventors of these instruments.”41

狄德罗和达朗贝尔的《百科全书》生动地说明了所有这些趋势。这部由 130 多位作者撰写的约 74,000 个条目，这一宏伟的知识工程不可避免地缺乏一致性。在《百科全书》中，传说以缩写和扩展的形式出现在海运保险和汇票中，有时伴有背书，有时伴有怀疑或修订。40在提到该传说的条目中，有两个主要依靠孟德斯鸠，一个主要依靠克莱拉克和萨瓦里。安托万·加斯帕德·布歇·达·阿吉斯（Antoine-Gaspard Boucher d‘Argis）是一位著名的律师，他的著作在 1762 年一次臭名昭著的审判中被用来为胡格诺商人让·卡拉斯开脱罪责，他的 “Lettre de change” 条目借用了《海洋的用途和习俗》 和Le parfaitnégociant的内容，从这两个文献中抽取了整个章节。Boucher d’Argis 对这个传说的真实性提出了质疑，但最后他没有接受 Dupuis de la Serra 对这个叙述的合理性提出的异议。相反，在承认犹太人发明汇票的历史记载不一致之后，他得出结论。“然而，很难想象犹太人在逃往伦巴第时没有采取任何预防措施来挽救他们的货物 —— 这一点只有通过汇票才能做到。因此，有理由相信他们是这些工具的第一批发明者”。41

This passage reveals how Jewish cunning was the one attribute that no one disputed. For Boucher d’Argis, the legend contained a kernel of truth because he assumed that Jews possessed superior economic skill. His readers appreciated the comparison that he left implicit: other groups had been subjected to expropriation before, but the Jews were “the first” to have devised the means to “salvage their goods.” Dupuis de la Serra had questioned the historical account passed on by Cleirac on logical grounds. Boucher d’Argis proceeded in the opposite way: he recognized several flaws in that historical account but found part of its logic unassailable. The compromise he reached is instructive of a broader trend: in the second half of the eighteenth century, the Enlightenment’s emphasis on the historical and circumstantial causes of Jews’ economic shrewdness coexisted with a belief in their essential character as wily speculators.42

这段话揭示了犹太人的狡猾是没有人质疑的一个属性。对布歇·德·阿吉来说，这个传说包含了一个真理的内核，因为他假设犹太人拥有卓越的经济技能。他的读者很欣赏他隐含的比较：其他群体以前也被征用过，但犹太人是 “第一个” 想出 “挽救他们的货物” 的方法。杜普伊斯·德拉·塞拉（Dupuis de la Serra）曾以逻辑理由质疑克莱拉克所传的历史记载。Boucher d'Argis 则以相反的方式进行：他承认该历史叙述中有几个缺陷，但认为其部分逻辑是不可推翻的。他达成的妥协对一个更广泛的趋势具有指导意义：在 18 世纪下半叶，启蒙运动对犹太人经济精明的历史和环境原因的强调与对他们作为狡猾的投机者的基本特征的信念并存。42

The other two entries in the Encyclopédie that recounted the legend with regard to bills of exchange instead bore Montesquieu’s imprint: they used the tale to denounce the exploitative policies of arbitrary rulers and to exalt the ingenious resistance of a persecuted minority. Both François Véron de Forbonnais’s entry on “commerce” and Chevalier Louis de Jaucourt’s “Juif” depicted the Middle Ages (“the barbarous centuries”) as a time when trade was in the hands of Jews, referring to them as “a wandering people” and as “infamous usurers,” respectively. But if Forbonnais treated Jews as incidental to the rise of commerce, Jaucourt praised their skills and art of survival in the face of oppression and embraced the mainstream position of defenders of Jewish rights: external constrictions rather than natural proclivity explained why Jews flocked to commerce, an economic activity that Christians loathed.43

百科全书》中另外两个讲述汇票传说的条目反而打上了孟德斯鸠的烙印：它们用这个故事来谴责专制统治者的剥削政策，赞美受迫害的少数人的巧妙抵抗。弗朗索瓦·维龙·德·福尔邦尼（François Véron de Forbonnais）的 “商业” 条目和 路易斯·德·约库尔骑士（Chevalier Louis de Jaucourt）的 “Juif” 都将中世纪（“野蛮的世纪”）描绘成一个贸易掌握在犹太人手中的时代，分别将他们称为 “一个流浪的民族” 和 “臭名昭著的高利贷者”。但是，如果说福尔邦纳把犹太人当作商业兴起的附带品，那么焦库尔则赞扬了他们面对压迫时的生存技能和艺术，并接受了犹太人权利捍卫者的主流立场：外部限制而不是自然倾向解释了犹太人为什么会涌向商业，一种基督教徒所厌恶的经济活动。43

Curiously, Forbonnais and Jaucourt were even more adamant than Montesquieu in singling out Jews’ financial inventiveness compared to other trading communities that suffered persecution. The Persian Letters foreshadowed the sociological theory of “middleman minorities,” merchant groups that strove to be indispensable to those societies that denied them full opportunities.44The Spirit of the Laws stressed the economic proficiency not only of Jews but of all hounded groups.45 No close comparison between Jews and other trading communities figured in any of these authors’ works. Rather, skillfully elaborating on Montesquieu’s ideas, Jaucourt penned a passage that the consortium of printers who owned the rights to this and associated publications reproduced several times. It is worth citing the segment in full because of its curious fate:

奇怪的是，福尔邦纳和约库尔甚至比孟德斯鸠更坚定地指出，与其他遭受迫害的贸易群体相比，犹太人在金融方面具有创造性。波斯书信》预示了 “中间人少数” 的社会学理论，这些商人群体，努力成为那些拒绝给他们充分机会的社会所不可或缺的人。44《法律的精神》不仅强调了犹太人的经济能力，而且强调了所有被追捕的群体的经济能力。45在这些作者的作品中，没有对犹太人和其他贸易群体进行密切比较。相反，乔库尔巧妙地阐述了孟德斯鸠的观点，写下了一段话，拥有该出版物和相关出版物版权的印刷商集团多次复制了这段话。由于这段话的奇特命运，值得全文引用。

In the end, constantly expelled from every country, they [the Jews] found the ingenious means to save their fortunes and to ensure their withdrawals. Banned from France under Philip the Tall in 1318, they found refuge in Lombardy and there, they gave merchants letters drawn upon those to whom they had entrusted their goods before leaving, and these letters were settled. The admirable invention of bills of exchange was born out of desperation and only thanks to them was commerce able to elude violence and sustain itself across the globe.46

最后，他们犹太人不断地被驱逐出各个国家，他们找到了巧妙的手段来挽救他们的财富，并确保他们的撤退。1318 年，在菲利普大帝统治下的法国被禁止入境，他们在伦巴第找到了避难所，在那里，他们向商人提供了在离开前将货物托付给他们的人所开的信，这些信被结算了。汇票这一令人钦佩的发明是在绝望中诞生的，只有靠它们，商业才能够避开暴力，在全球范围内维持下去。46

The absence of modern copyright laws combined with the acumen of those in charge of what Robert Darnton calls “the business of enlightenment” ensured that these lines were reproduced verbatim in numerous publications sponsored by the fictional société de gens de lettres , a label that was meant to convey the collective effort of those writers engaged in the project of enlightening the public.47 The passage even appeared in a spurious entry on Jews in several posthumous editions of Voltaire’s Dictionnaire philosophique , which, in four loosely related sections, meshed together antiquarian knowledge with tendentious readings of the Bible to produce a baffling account of the alleged absurdity of Jewish rites and the obtuseness of Jewish people. Buried amid derision and hostility was an ambivalent appreciation of Jews’ commercial prowess, contained mostly in the third section (“On the dispersion of Jews”) and derivative of Montesquieu’s thought in both argument and form. Though inauthentic, the entry is consistent with Voltaire’s negative views of Spain as a place where the Catholic Church and the nobility despised Jews and commerce alike. However, while its admiration for the purported Jewish invention of bills of exchange fits with Voltaire’s belief in Jews’ commercial aptitude, the passage is first and foremost a careless repetition of an authoritative cliché.48

现代版权法的缺失，加上那些负责罗伯特·达恩顿所说的 “启蒙事业” 的人的聪明才智，确保了这些句子被逐字逐句地转载到由虚构的 “文学社” 赞助的许多出版物上，这个标签旨在传达那些从事启蒙公众项目的作家的集体努力。47这段话甚至出现在伏尔泰的《哲学词典》的几个遗留版本中关于犹太人的虚假条目中，该词典在四个松散相关的部分中，将古籍知识与对《圣经》的倾向性解读混为一谈，对所谓的犹太仪式的荒谬性和犹太人的愚昧性做出了令人费解的描述。埋藏在嘲笑和敌意中的是对犹太人商业能力的矛盾赞赏，主要包含在第三部分（“论犹太人的分散”），在论证和形式上都是孟德斯鸠思想的衍生。虽然这篇文章不是真实的，但它与伏尔泰对西班牙的负面看法是一致的，即天主教会和贵族都鄙视犹太人和商业。然而，虽然它对据称是犹太人发明的汇票的赞美符合伏尔泰对犹太人商业能力的信念，但这段话首先是对一个权威性陈词滥调的不经意重复。48

The legend revealed once again its protean qualities. The spurious text attributed to Voltaire radiated contrarian meanings, but its putative author’s fame ensured that the echoes of this sketchy and untenable historical account traveled fast and widely. More generally, during the second half of the eighteenth century, admirers of Montesquieu followed him in evoking the legend without making scornful reference to Jews. But since they trusted their muse, they also did not question his reliability. The massive and incredibly popular Histoire philosophique et politique des deux Indes (1770) incorporated the legend as transmitted by Montesquieu in order to press one of its favorite themes, the triumph of ingenuity over church superstition.49 In a contemporaneous “universal history” presented as the collective labor of une société de gens de lettres , the legend resurfaced in the narrative of the massacre of the Jewish community of Munich in 1285. The authors defended the innocence of the Jews emphatically and depicted avarice as a Christian crime, portraying commoners, clergymen, and ruling authorities as blinded by their hatred of Jews and their desire to seize Jews’ wealth. The legend was thus reframed as a tale of survival and Jewish inventiveness: when armed Christians stormed Jewish homes ready to steal their belongings, all they found were slips of paper—the bills of exchange that Jews had devised in order to protect their assets; given that they could not redeem those bills, the Christian looters had to live with the shame of having killed for nothing.50

这个传说再次显示了它的保护性特征。归于伏尔泰的虚假文本散发着相反的含义，但其假定的作者的，确保了这一简略和不成立的历史叙述的回声快速而广泛地传播。更为普遍的是，在十八世纪下半叶，孟德斯鸠的崇拜者们跟随他唤起了这个传说，而没有轻蔑地提及犹太人。但由于他们信任他们的缪斯，他们也没有质疑他的可靠性。规模宏大、广受欢迎的《印度哲学与政治史》（Histoire philosophique et politique des deux Indes，1770）纳入了孟德斯鸠传播的传说，以强调其最喜爱的主题之一，即智慧对教会迷信的胜利。49在一部同时代的 “世界历史” 中，作为一个文学社的集体劳动，这个传说在 1285 年慕尼黑犹太人社区被屠杀的叙述中再次出现。作者极力为犹太人的清白辩护，并将贪婪描绘成基督教的罪行，将平民、神职人员和统治当局描绘成被他们对犹太人的仇恨和夺取犹太人财富的欲望所蒙蔽。因此，这个传说被重塑为一个关于生存和犹太人创造力的故事：当武装的基督徒冲进犹太人的家中准备偷窃他们的财物时，他们找到的只是纸条 —— 犹太人为了保护他们的财产而设计的汇票；鉴于他们无法赎回这些汇票，基督教抢劫者不得不带着白杀的耻辱生活。50

Intent on using the legend as a redemptive allegory, Montesquieu’s followers showed little interest in disputes over its veracity and repeated it in all sorts of genres, including memoirs and travel accounts.51 By contrast, the French commercial and legal literature of the second half of the eighteenth century propagated a more negative view of Jewish usury, derived from the accounts of Cleirac and Savary, while also cultivating doubts about the tale’s accuracy and offering alternative narratives of the invention of medieval financial instruments. An authoritative commentary on the 1681 ordonnance de la marine published in 1760 oscillated between confirming the assertion by Franz Stypmann (1612–1650), a leading writer of maritime law, that marine insurance first emerged in medieval Italy and following the common view according to which “the Jews, who are usurers by nature,” invented marine insurance and used it to make inequitable loans.52 Jews’ usurious character was often taken for granted in the literature on commerce. Cleirac had captured this belief in a dictum that resurfaced in the eighteenth century: in the Levant, he wrote, “Jews, Turkish merchants, Armenians, Persians, Arabs, those from Alexandria and the Moors” charged so-called “lunar interests.”53 Since lunar months are slightly shorter than those of the Gregorian calendar, the expression indicated the charging of higher interest rates than normal.

孟德斯鸠的追随者们有意将这个传说作为一个救赎性的寓言，对其真实性的争议兴趣不大，并在包括回忆录和旅行记事在内的各种体裁中重复它。51相比之下，18 世纪下半叶的法国商业和法律文献宣传了对犹太人高利贷的更负面的看法，这些看法来自克莱拉克和萨瓦里的描述，同时也培养了对这个故事准确性的怀疑，并提供了关于中世纪金融工具发明的其他叙述。1760 年出版的关于 1681 年《海事条例》的权威评论在确认海商法的主要作家弗朗兹·斯蒂普曼（Franz Stypmann）（1612-1650）的断言之间摇摆不定，即海事保险首先出现在中世纪的意大利，同时也遵循普遍的观点，即 “犹太人天生就是高利贷者”，他们发明了海事保险并利用它来进行不公平的贷款。52犹太人的高利贷特征在关于商业的文献中常常被认为是理所当然的。克莱拉克在 18 世纪重新出现的一句话中抓住了这种信念：他写道，在黎凡特，“犹太人、土耳其商人、亚美尼亚人、波斯人、阿拉伯人、来自亚历山大的人和摩尔人” 收取所谓的 “阴历利息”。53由于阴历的月份比公历的月份略短，所以这种说法表示收取的利息比正常情况下要高。

Meanwhile, an antiquarian search for the earliest documentary evidence of medieval marine insurance and bills of exchange further undermined the legend, with France’s leading Roman law jurist, Robert Joseph Pothier (1699–1772), presenting textual evidence from classical antiquity and the Middle Ages that challenged its validity.54 Other sources of growing skepticism were natural law accounts of the emergence of commerce. Those for whom necessity was the mother of invention found it superfluous to search for an individual or group responsible for any pathbreaking innovation. Following this logic, the need to make payments at a distance and mitigate the risks of long-distance trade spurred a spontaneous development of new solutions to address those needs. One comprehensive treatise on marine insurance dismissed as futile the debate over whether Italians or Jews had contributed most to the creation of marine insurance, “a contract that was born out of the nature of things.”55 A few sixteenth-century Italian authors had already described these credit instruments as the result of cumulative and collective knowledge rather than the genius of a single people.56 One merchant manual expressed the belief that only a dramatic event could have given rise to bills of exchange but credited “the spirit of commerce,” which encouraged creativity and led to useful discoveries, with their invention.57

同时，对中世纪海事保险和汇票的最早文献证据的古籍搜索进一步破坏了这一传说，法国主要的罗马法法学家罗伯特·约瑟夫·波蒂埃（1699-1772）提出了来自古代和中世纪的文本证据，对其有效性提出了挑战。54越来越多的怀疑论的其他来源是关于商业出现的自然法描述。那些认为必要性是发明之母的人认为，寻找一个对任何开拓性创新负责的个人或团体是多余的。按照这一逻辑，远距离支付和减轻远距离贸易风险的需要促使人们自发地开发新的解决方案来满足这些需要。一篇关于海事保险的综合论文认为，关于意大利人还是犹太人对海事保险的创造贡献最大的争论是徒劳的，“这是一种从事物的本质中诞生的合同”。55一些十六世纪的意大利作者已经将这些信用工具描述为累积和集体知识的结果，而不是单一民族的天才。56一本商人手册表示相信，只有一个戏剧性的事件才会产生汇票，但却把汇票的发明归功于 “商业精神”，因为商业精神鼓励创造并导致有用的发现。57

In sum, by the last quarter of the eighteenth century, the legend was in wide circulation and was being subjected to considerable scrutiny. More than anyone else, Montesquieu gave it a new and positive meaning by linking commerce to toleration. However, when the debate on Jewish emancipation erupted in the French public sphere, the legend reappeared in an older, less favorable light.

总之，到了十八世纪的最后四分之一，这个传说被广泛流传，并受到了相当的审查。孟德斯鸠比任何人都更多地将商业与宽容联系起来，赋予它新的积极意义。然而，当关于犹太人解放的辩论在法国公共领域爆发时，这个传说以一种更古老、更不利的方式重新出现了。

Phase IV (1775–1791): Usury, the Spirit of Commerce, and Emancipation

第四阶段（1775-1791）：高利贷、商业精神和解放思想

Hertzberg maintains that in the late eighteenth century, “Montesquieu was consistently quoted by all those who were on the side of the Jews.”58 In fact, Montesquieu’s influence over the debates on emancipation was more ambiguous. Jews’ involvement in moneylending and commerce became a touchstone in those debates as they unfolded in the northeastern regions of France during the last quarter of the eighteenth century. In that environment, which was quite unlike that of southwestern France, where Montesquieu had recast the legend in positive terms, Cleirac’s and Savary’s cautionary tales of the pernicious effects of Jewish usury still resonated.

赫兹伯格认为，在十八世纪末，“孟德斯鸠一直被所有站在犹太人一边的人所引用”。58事实上，孟德斯鸠对解放问题的辩论的影响更加模糊。犹太人参与放贷和商业活动成为这些辩论的试金石，因为这些辩论是在 18 世纪最后 25 年在法国东北部地区展开的。在这种环境下，与法国西南部的环境完全不同，孟德斯鸠在那里以积极的方式重塑了这个传说，克莱拉克和萨瓦里关于犹太人高利贷的有害影响的警示故事仍然引起了共鸣。

Demands to extend full civic rights to Jewish men were first voiced in earnest during the 1770s in Alsace and Lorraine, and provoked no small outcry. The largest portion of France’s Jews (roughly 30,000 individuals) resided in this region. Their economic status and social makeup differed markedly from those of the Jews in Bordeaux. Never forced to conceal their religious identity, Franco-Ashkenazim spoke Yiddish, maintained their religious traditions, and were limited in their economic and legal freedoms. They were banned from all cities, except Metz, unless they paid a humiliating personal transit tax. Forbidden from owning real estate, cultivating the land, joining craft guilds, or hiring non-Jewish help, most of them lived in small enclaves in the countryside and earned their living as peddlers, moneylenders, sellers of used goods and clothes, or workers in the cattle trade; only the most affluent were involved in provisioning the army with horses and other necessities.59

17 世纪 70 年代，在阿尔萨斯和洛林，人们首次认真地提出了向犹太男子提供充分公民权利的要求，并引起了不小的反响。法国最大的一部分犹太人（大约 30,000 人）居住在这个地区。他们的经济地位和社会构成与波尔多的犹太人有明显的不同。法国阿什肯纳兹人从未被迫隐瞒他们的宗教身份，他们讲意第绪语，保持他们的宗教传统，并在经济和法律自由方面受到限制。他们被禁止进入除梅斯以外的所有城市，除非他们支付羞辱性的个人过境税。他们被禁止拥有房地产、耕种土地、加入手工业行会或雇用非犹太人的帮助，他们中的大多数人住在农村的小飞地里，以小贩、放债人、卖旧货和衣服的人或牲畜贸易的工人为生；只有最富裕的人参与为军队提供马匹和其他必需品。59

In these adverse circumstances, the earliest gentile advocate of Jewish rights was also the most radical. In 1775, Pierre-Louis Lacretelle (1751–1824), an audacious lawyer and later a moderate revolutionary, called for the full equality of Jews as men (hommes ) and as subjects of the kingdom (régnicoles ).60 Less bent than others on demanding that Jews be “regenerated,” he nonetheless advocated passing special laws to limit Jews’ economic activities.61 Although Lacratelle denounced the contemporary public hatred of Jews, he attributed it in no small part to their practice of usury and friponnerie .62

在这种不利的情况下，最早倡导犹太人权利的外邦人也是最激进的。1775 年，皮埃尔·路易·拉克莱特（Pierre-Louis Lacretelle，1751-1824），一位大胆的律师，后来成为一名温和的革命者，呼吁犹太人作为男人（hommes）和王国的臣民（régnicoles）完全平等。60在要求犹太人 “再生” 的问题上，他不像其他人那样一意孤行，但他还是主张通过特别法律来限制犹太人的经济活动。61尽管拉克拉泰尔谴责当代公众对犹太人的仇恨，但他认为这在很大程度上是由于他们的高利贷和欺诈行为。62
