战时看到资本主义在中世纪形成的经济史学家来自广泛的政治光谱，但都把犹太人归入其调查的边缘，如果他们讨论他们的话。在法国，他们包括反马克思主义者，如亨利·塞（1864-1936）和安德烈-E。Sayous（1873-1940），以及像亨利·豪泽（1866-1946）这样的马克思主义者。54在意大利，一个法律经济学派通过对中世纪商业法的开创性研究，包括一些侧重于海事保险和汇票的研究，预见到了中世纪主义者的早期反叛。可以预见的是，一旦他们仔细研究了热那亚、威尼斯和其他意大利中世纪城市的档案记录，这些学者，其中一些人，特别是亚历山德罗·拉特斯（1858-1940）和阿图罗·塞格雷（1873-1928）是犹太人，没有发现所谓犹太人发明汇票的痕迹。更广泛地说，他们否定了犹太人是中世纪国际贸易和金融的主要参与者这一观点。55

A different group of Italian medievalists proved even more influential. Intent on stressing the compatibility of Christianity and capitalism, they denied Jews any role in the genesis of the latter. The two best-known of these scholars were Amintore Fanfani (1908–1999), who replaced the esteemed Jewish medievalist Gino Luzzatto (1878–1964) at the University of Venice while the Racial Laws of 1938 were in effect and served five times as Democratic Christian prime minister of the postwar Italian Republic, and Armando Sapori (1892–1976), a senator from the non-Communist Left and a scholar who wielded tremendous academic power from his position at the Università Luigi Bocconi in Milan. While Fanfani criticized Weber’s emphasis on Protestantism, Sapori took issue with Sombart. Both insisted that the origins of modern capitalism resided in the Italian medieval communes and were infused with Christian ethics and a sense of solidarity—a depiction designed to lessen the atomized character of early capitalism. In order to buttress their thesis, they pushed Jews to the fringes of medieval urban economies by portraying them as pawnbrokers rather than international traders. In a 1964 volume of reflections on Sombart’s wide-ranging work and its Italian reception that Fanfani edited, no mention was made of the The Jews and Economic Life .56

事实证明，另一批意大利中世纪学者的影响甚至更大。他们意在强调基督教和资本主义的兼容性，否认犹太人在资本主义的起源中扮演任何角色。其中最著名的两位学者是阿明托里·范法尼（1908-1999），在 1938 年种族法生效时，他在威尼斯大学取代了受人尊敬的犹太中世纪学者吉诺·卢扎托（1878-1964），并五次担任战后意大利共和国的民主基督教总理。和阿曼多·萨波里（Armando Sapori）（1892-1976），一位来自非共产主义左派的参议员和一位在米兰的路易吉·博科尼大学（Luigi Bocconi）的职位上掌握着巨大学术权力的学者。范法尼批评了韦伯对新教的强调，而萨波里则对桑巴特提出了异议。两人都坚持认为，现代资本主义的源头在意大利的中世纪公社，并被注入了基督教伦理和团结意识 —— 这种描述旨在减少早期资本主义的原子化特征。为了支持他们的论点，他们把犹太人推到了中世纪城市经济的边缘，把他们描绘成典当商而不是国际贸易商。在范法尼编辑的 1964 年关于桑巴特的广泛工作及其在意大利的接受情况的思考卷中，没有提到《犹太人和经济生活》。56

Medievalists led the way among British economic historians of the interwar period but they also sidelined the topic of Jewish economic activities, in part because their studies privileged agriculture over long-distance trade and in part because they focused on England, which had expelled Jews as early as 1290.57 Robert Sabatino Lopez (1910–1986), an Italian Jewish refugee to the United States, where he arrived soon after losing his university position in Genoa under Fascism, shared Pirenne’s interest in the revival of late medieval European cities.58 His many studies of Genoese and Mediterranean trade culminated in The Commercial Revolution of the Middle Ages, 950–1350 (1971), which made the most powerful statement to date about the direct descent of modern capitalism from its medieval predecessor: “And if medieval growth was not fast, it was altogether irreversible; it created the indispensable material and moral conditions for a thousand years of virtually uninterrupted growth; and, in more than one way, it is still with us.”59

中世纪学者在战时的英国经济史学家中处于领先地位，但他们也将犹太经济活动的话题搁置一边，部分原因是他们的研究将农业置于长距离贸易之上，部分原因是他们关注的是英国，英国早在 1290 年就驱逐了犹太人。57罗伯特·萨巴蒂诺·洛佩斯（Robert Sabatino Lopez，1910-1986）是一位前往美国的意大利犹太难民，他在法西斯主义下失去了在热那亚的大学职位后不久就来到美国，与皮雷纳一样对欧洲中世纪后期城市的复兴感兴趣。58他对热那亚和地中海贸易的许多研究在《中世纪的商业革命，950-1350》（1971）中达到了顶峰，，该书对现代资本主义直接从中世纪的前身降生做出了迄今为止最有力的陈述。“如果说中世纪的增长速度不快，那么它是完全不可逆转的；它为一千年来几乎不间断的增长创造了不可或缺的物质和道德条件；而且，在不止一个方面，它仍然伴随着我们”。59

The book included a brief section on “the Jews,” which described them as the only group that from the ninth to the early eleventh centuries was “left to provide a link, however tenuous, between Catholic Europe and the more advanced countries beyond it: the Islamic world, the Byzantine Empire, even India and China”; in Europe, too, Lopez added, “for certain villages, the resident or transient Jews represented the only window open onto the world.”60 But in Lopez’s overall narrative, the lead characters were the Italian merchants of the late Middle Ages. The Belgian accountant-turned-historian Raymond de Roover (1904–1972), who had coined the expression “commercial revolution of the Middle Ages,” concurred entirely.61 And in his studies of Scholastic economic thought, he went even further in Christianizing medieval capitalism.62

该书包括一个关于 “犹太人” 的简短章节，其中将他们描述为从第九世纪到第十一世纪初 “留下的唯一一个群体，在天主教欧洲和它以外的更先进的国家之间提供一个联系，无论多么脆弱：伊斯兰世界、拜占庭帝国，甚至印度和中国”；在欧洲，洛佩兹也补充说，“对于某些村庄，常驻或流动的犹太人代表着向世界开放的唯一窗口”。60但在洛佩兹的整体叙述中，主角是中世纪晚期的意大利商人。曾创造了 “中世纪商业革命” 这一说法的比利时会计师转行的历史学家雷蒙德·德·罗弗（1904-1972）完全赞同。61在他对学派经济思想的研究中，他甚至进一步将中世纪的资本主义基督教化。62

After this fertile season of scholarship, research on medieval commercial contracts, including marine insurance and bills of exchange, and their evolution in the sixteenth century retreated into a corner of the academy. Today, the most influential narratives about Europe’s takeoff focus on the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries, and the leading causes to which various scholars attribute the primacy of Europe over Asia (public finance and representative institutions, colonialism and slavery, high wages and technological innovation) do not include the fruits of the medieval commercial revolution, for reasons I will return to in the coda.63

在这个肥沃的学术季节之后，关于中世纪商业合同的研究，包括海事保险和汇票，以及它们在 16 世纪的演变，则退回到学术界的一个角落。今天，关于欧洲腾飞的最有影响力的叙述集中在十七和十八世纪，而各种学者将欧洲超越亚洲的首要原因（公共财政和代议制、殖民主义和奴隶制、高工资和技术创新）并不包括中世纪商业革命的成果，原因我将在结尾部分再谈。63

Conclusion

总结

That the founders of modern social theory were well acquainted with the legend of the Jewish origin of bills of exchange—and that some of them embraced it outright—should be cause for reflection. By the late eighteenth century, the notion that medieval Jews might have been responsible for devising key European financial instruments had come under increasing scrutiny for its evidentiary fallacies and inconsistent storyline. One might well have expected the rise of academic scholarship in the nineteenth century to seal the fate of the legend. To the contrary, the improbable tale experienced a rich afterlife in the age of positivism. In spite of attempts to set the record straight, notably Goldschmit’s authoritative study of commercial law, the account attributing to Jews the invention of bills of exchange entered a new phase when, in 1875, Roscher transformed that moral tale into a pseudo-fact. He did so without invoking any source, as if the notion that Jews invented bills of exchange needed no corroboration, wiping out nearly two centuries of debate over the meaning and plausibility of Cleirac’s tale of origins. Ultimately, Roscher turned a fantasy about the past into a legitimate and commanding academic statement, which, in Sombart’s hands, fueled new fantasies.

现代社会理论的创始人对汇票起源于犹太人的传说非常熟悉，而且他们中的一些人直接接受了这个传说，这应该引起我们的反思。到了 18 世纪末，中世纪犹太人可能是设计欧洲主要金融工具的人这一概念因其证据上的谬误和不一致的故事情节而受到越来越多的审查。人们很可能认为，19 世纪学术研究的兴起会封住这个传说的命运。恰恰相反，这个不可能的故事在实证主义时代经历了丰富的来世。尽管有人试图澄清事实，，特别是戈德施密特对商业法的权威研究，但当 1875 年罗舍尔将这个道德故事变成一个伪事实时，将汇票的发明归于犹太人的说法进入了一个新阶段。他在这样做的时候没有引用任何消息来源，似乎犹太人发明汇票的概念不需要证实，从而使近两个世纪以来关于克莱拉克的起源故事的意义和合理性的辩论化为乌有。最终，罗舍尔将一个关于过去的幻想变成了一个合法的、有号召力的学术声明，而这一声明在桑巴特的手中又助长了新的幻想。

And insidious fantasies they were. Today it is common practice to take Weber to task for his Orientalist distortions, which led him to portray all premodern Islamic societies as lacking both entrepreneurship and robust political institutions. But when measured against the available secondary literature and the prevailing standards of source criticism of the time, Sombart’s scholarly practice must be judged to be far shoddier than Weber’s. And yet there has been a recent revival of interest in his thesis about Jews and capitalism, as if its more damaging and problematic implications could be set aside (coda).

而这些幻想是阴险的。今天，人们普遍认为韦伯的东方主义歪曲，导致他将所有前现代伊斯兰社会描绘成缺乏企业家精神和健全的政治机构。但是，如果用现有的二手文献和当时流行的来源批评标准来衡量，桑巴特的学术实践必须被判定为比韦伯的学术实践要低劣得多。然而，最近对他关于犹太人和资本主义的论述又有了新的兴趣，似乎其更具破坏性和问题性的影响可以被搁置一边（结尾）。

More than the veracity of the legend itself, the place of Jews in the historical arc of Western modernity became the subject of intense debate throughout the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries. During this period bills of exchange were still ordinary modes of payment, especially in international trade, and most of the scholars discussed in this chapter no doubt had direct or indirect knowledge of how they worked. But with the second industrial revolution underway, new economic and financial institutions, including factories, deposit banks, the corporation, and the stock market (rather than bills of exchange), became the focus of contemporary discussions of the productive and destructive forces of modern capitalism. The legend thus ceased to be a compass of the morality of credit, as it had been in the Old Regime, but entered the academic grand narratives about the emergence of Western capitalism.

比起传说本身的真实性，犹太人在西方现代性的历史弧线中的地位成为整个 19 世纪和 20 世纪初激烈辩论的主题。在这一时期，汇票仍然是普通的支付方式，特别是在国际贸易中，本章所讨论的大多数学者无疑都直接或间接了解汇票的运作方式。但随着第二次工业革命的进行，新的经济和金融机构，包括工厂、存款银行、公司和股票市场（而不是汇票），成为当代讨论现代资本主义生产和破坏力量的焦点。因此，这个传说不再像在旧制度下那样是信用道德的指南针，而是进入了关于西方资本主义出现的学术宏大叙事中。

Different definitions of capitalism and different evaluations of the historical trajectories leading to it meant that Jews were assigned different positions in these grand narratives. For the young Marx, Jews and Judaism did not represent a stage in capitalist development but rather personified modern capitalism tout court . By contrast, Weber was not only more interested in capitalism than in Jews, but also intent on salvaging what was good in capitalism as a hallmark of Western civilization. With that intent, he purged his account of any Jewish traces, regarding Jews and Judaism as inferior and extraneous to that civilization. For Sombart, in contrast, capitalism bred moral decline, which is why it had a Jewish face.

对资本主义的不同定义和对导致资本主义的历史轨迹的不同评价，意味着犹太人在这些宏大叙事中被赋予不同的地位。对于年轻的马克思来说，犹太人和犹太教并不代表资本主义发展的一个阶段，而是将现代资本主义完全人格化。相比之下，韦伯不仅对资本主义比对犹太人更感兴趣，而且还打算挽救资本主义中作为西方文明标志的美好东西。出于这个目的，他清除了他的叙述中的任何犹太人的痕迹，把犹太人和犹太教视为低级的、与该文明无关的东西。相反，对 Sombart 来说，资本主义滋生了道德滑坡，这就是为什么它有一个犹太人的面孔。

Sombart stood out in the increasingly crowded field of scholars debating “Jewish contributions to Western civilization” because he glorified not the achievements of medieval Iberian Jewries but the commercial and financial networks of those Jews who had been expelled or forced to convert in the 1490s. This shift of focus also meant that he treated all New Christians as crypto-Jews whose economic cunning was even more insidious than that of practicing Jews, because the true nature and genuine allegiances of those who possessed it were hard to discern. The inability to distinguish baptized Jews and their descendants from the rest of the population had rendered these individuals particularly suspicious in Old Regime Bordeaux, where they were suspected of paying only outward homage to their new religion while commanding significant economic influence and allying with hostile political forces. This blurring of the line dividing Jews from non-Jews remained the source of lingering reservations after Jews were granted political equality. At the turn of the twentieth century, so-called scientific racism, which promised to render Jews visible after they had become legally indistinguishable from their Christian peers, tainted all discussions of what bonded Jews together (regardless of whether or not one agrees that Sombart embraced a racial theory of Jews).

桑巴特在日益拥挤的辩论 “犹太人对西方文明的贡献” 的学者中脱颖而出，因为他美化的不是中世纪伊比利亚犹太人的成就，而是那些在 1490 年代被驱逐或被迫皈依的犹太人的商业和金融网络。这种焦点的转移也意味着他把所有新基督徒当作隐性犹太人，他们的经济狡猾甚至比执业犹太人的狡猾更阴险，因为拥有这种狡猾的人的真实性质和真正的效忠是难以辨别的。由于无法将受洗的犹太人及其后裔与其他人口区分开来，这些人在旧政体的波尔多特别可疑，他们被怀疑只在外表上向他们的新宗教表示敬意，却掌握着重要的经济影响力并与敌对的政治力量结盟。在犹太人获得政治平等地位后，这种模糊了犹太人与非犹太人的界限的做法仍然是挥之不去的保留的根源。在二十世纪之交，所谓的科学种族主义，承诺在犹太人在法律上与他们的基督教同龄人没有区别之后使他们变得明显，这玷污了所有关于是什么将犹太人联系在一起的讨论（不管人们是否同意 Sombart 接受了犹太人的种族理论）。

The medievalists who rebuffed the assertion that economic modernity started with the Jewish invention of bills of exchange agreed on one thing: Marx, Sombart, and Weber underestimated the many and lasting contributions that the Middle Ages made to the so-called Rise of the West. But the Middle Ages these scholars had inherited from previous generations was stained by accounts that posited oversized roles for Jewish usury. From the mid-seventeenth to the early twentieth centuries, scores of writers had battled over the proper place of commerce, and Jewish commerce in particular, in European (i.e., Christian) societies. In their revolt, interwar medievalists pushed Jews to the margins of their investigations as a way of cleansing the stain that any associations of capitalism with Jews carried. In the process, they also contributed to pushing Jewish history out of the mainstream, consigning it to a subfield of academic inquiry into which few nonspecialists roam.

那些反驳经济现代性始于犹太人发明的汇票这一论断的中世纪学者在一件事上达成了共识：马克思、桑巴特和韦伯低估了中世纪对所谓的西方崛起所作出的许多持久的贡献。但是，这些学者从前几代人那里继承的中世纪，被那些认为犹太人的高利贷作用过大的说法所玷污。从十七世纪中叶到二十世纪初，许多作家就商业，特别是犹太商业在欧洲（即基督教）社会中的适当地位进行了争论。在他们的反抗中，战时的中世纪主义者将犹太人推到了他们调查的边缘，以此来洗刷任何与犹太人有关的资本主义的污点。在这个过程中，他们也促成了将犹太历史推到主流之外，将其归入学术调查的一个子领域，很少有非专业人士涉足。

Coda

No retrospect will take us to the true beginning.

任何回顾都不会把我们带到真正的起点。

—GEORGE ELIOT, DANIEL DERONDA (1876)1

-乔治·艾略特，丹尼尔·德隆达（1876）。1

THIS BOOK BEGAN with a chance encounter. A few lines in the best known of all seventeenth-century European merchant manuals jumped off the page because they made little sense to this modern reader. Over the years, curiosity and stubbornness prompted me to stay with these lines. In the end, I was able to document how a forgotten tale of the origins of European financial capitalism constituted conventional wisdom from the 1650s to the 1910s to such a degree that those who did not believe in it had to go out of their way to contest it.

本书始于一次偶然的邂逅。十七世纪欧洲最著名的商人手册中的几行字跃然纸上，因为它们对这位现代读者来说毫无意义。多年来，好奇心和顽固性促使我一直关注这几句话。最后，我能够记录下一个被遗忘的关于欧洲金融资本主义起源的故事是如何在 1650 年代到 1910 年代构成传统智慧的，以至于那些不相信它的人不得不去质疑它。

Throughout these 250 years, what I have called the legend of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange absorbed and at the same time transformed conceptions of Jewish usury that had emerged in the thirteenth century. Resilient as those conceptions proved to be across time, they also evolved and adapted in response to new realities and competing discursive traditions. In fact, the legend analyzed here, as capacious and malleable as any other, served multiple, sometimes even conflicting, agendas. By mapping the routes of its transmission, I have shown why this tale became a powerful tool for debating and policing the boundaries of European commercial society and why it planted deeper roots in France than in the rest of Old Regime Europe. Finally, I have concluded with an excursus on the afterlife of the legend in the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries, which has revealed how central to European economic history this narrative was until a century ago.

在这 250 年中，我所说的犹太人发明汇票的传说吸收了 13 世纪出现的关于犹太人高利贷的概念，同时也改变了这种概念。尽管这些概念在不同时期被证明是有弹性的，但它们也随着新的现实和竞争性的话语传统而不断演变和调整。事实上，这里所分析的传说，和其他任何传说一样，具有丰富的容量和可塑性，服务于多种，有时甚至是相互冲突的议程。通过描绘其传播路线，我表明了为什么这个故事成为辩论和监督欧洲商业社会边界的有力工具，以及为什么它在法国的根基比在旧制度下的欧洲其他地区更深。最后，我以一篇关于该传说在 19 世纪和 20 世纪初的后遗症的短文作为结束，它揭示了直到一个世纪前这一叙事对欧洲经济历史的重要性。

One question remains: If the legend was as significant and widespread as I claim, why do we not know about it today? At the most basic level, its disappearance was to be expected: we no longer use bills of exchange, so we no longer worry about who invented them. Within the academy, however, the silence is less self-evident. The fact that the legend’s validity has been debunked does not explain its fall into oblivion. Origin stories continue to fascinate historians, anthropologists, and literary critics, less for the veracity of their content than for what they tell us about shared beliefs of societies different from ours. Scholars of humanism and early modern thought have documented the inexorable tendency of European chroniclers and historians to mix demonstrable facts, forgeries, and myths. In the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries, more consistent protocols of authentication and verification of textual and material pieces of evidence emerged, but they continued to coexist alongside utterly unsubstantiated reconstructions of the past.2 We thus remain interested in the so-called battle between the ancients and the moderns, whose competing claims about the value of imitation or originality responded to logics we no longer share; similarly, eighteenth-century projects of encyclopedic knowledge continue to intrigue us even if they fall short of modern evidentiary standards.

还有一个问题。如果这个传说像我所说的那样重要和广泛，为什么我们今天不知道它了？在最基本的层面上，它的消失是可以预期的：我们不再使用汇票，所以我们不再担心谁发明了它们。然而，在学术界，这种沉默却不那么不言而喻。传说的正确性被揭穿的事实并不能解释其被遗忘的原因。起源故事继续吸引着历史学家、人类学家和文学评论家，与其说是因为其内容的真实性，不如说是因为它们告诉我们与我们不同的社会的共同信仰。研究人文主义和早期现代思想的学者们记录了欧洲编年史家和历史学家将可证实的事实、伪造品和神话混合在一起的不可阻挡的趋势。在十七和十八世纪，出现了更加一致的文字和材料证据的认证和验证协议，但它们继续与完全未经证实的过去的重建并存。2因此，我们仍然对所谓的古人和现代人之间的斗争感兴趣，他们对模仿或原创的价值的竞争性主张回应了我们不再分享的逻辑；同样，十八世纪的百科知识项目仍然令我们感兴趣，即使它们没有达到现代的证据标准。

By contrast, we pay little attention to the combination of fact and fiction that punctuates the literature written by and for merchants, for the simple reason that we tend to assign to this literature a pragmatic function even as we recognize that merchant ethics was not easily separable from religious morality or that political imperatives tilted recommendations in favor of one economic solution over another. The legend I have examined throughout this book relied on a mixture of selective memory (Christian authors knew little about the Jewish past) and sheer fabrication (Jews in late medieval France and Italy had nothing to do with the invention of bills of exchange). This mixture helped make the legend an allegory of the hopes and fears brought about by the expansion of credit relations between people near and far, relations that were deemed to be at once extraordinarily beneficial and threatening to the established social and political order.

相比之下，我们很少注意由商人写的和为商人写的文学作品中的事实和虚构的结合，原因很简单，我们倾向于赋予这些文学作品以实用功能，即使我们认识到商人的道德不容易与宗教道德分开，或者政治需要使建议倾向于一种经济解决方案而不是另一种。我在本书中所研究的传说，依靠的是选择性记忆（基督教作者对犹太人的过去知之甚少）和纯粹的捏造（中世纪末法国和意大利的犹太人与汇票的发明毫无关系）的混合。这种混合有助于使这个传说成为一个寓言，说明远近人之间的信用关系的扩展所带来的希望和恐惧，这种关系被认为既对既定的社会和政治秩序有极大的好处，又有威胁。

The recent process of forgetting the legend in turn prompts us to review a number of trends, particularly pronounced in Anglophone scholarship, that have been underway within the academy over the past fifty years. I have already hinted at some of these trends when analyzing the disconnect between historians of the French Revolution and historians of Jewish emancipation in France: even when they examine the same events or the same authors (notably the Count of Mirabeau), they pass each other like ships in the night (chapter 6 ). To evaluate more systematically the reasons for the amnesia that surrounds the legend of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange is also to reflect on past and current modes of writing about European economic history, as I began to do at the end of the previous chapter, and to explain why my inquiry intersects with several fields, disciplines, and intellectual traditions and fits neatly into none.

最近遗忘传奇的过程反过来促使我们回顾过去五十年来学术界的一些趋势，特别是在英语国家的学术研究中明显的趋势。在分析法国大革命史学家和法国犹太人解放史学家之间的脱节时，我已经暗示了其中的一些趋势：即使他们研究相同的事件或相同的作者（特别是，米拉波伯爵），他们也像黑夜中的船只一样相互擦肩而过（第 6 章）。为了更系统地评估围绕犹太人发明汇票的传说的失忆原因，也是为了反思过去和现在关于欧洲经济史的写作模式，正如我在上一章末尾开始做的那样，也是为了解释为什么我的调查与几个领域、学科和知识传统相交，而又不适合任何领域。

Bills of exchange once held pride of place in economic and business history. In nineteenth-century German universities, economic history was taught in faculties of law. Legal and economic history were strongly linked in sectors of the French and Italian academies as well. From that perspective, bills of exchange were an ideal object of analysis: scholars disagreed sharply about the nature of the legal and financial arrangements that underpinned these bills and their historical evolution, but they all treated bills’ increasing complexity from the late medieval period to the seventeenth century as symptomatic of larger transformations in European history. No doubt an introduction to the history of bills of exchange was part of the training in economic history that Max Weber and Werner Sombart received. Both also absorbed the lessons of the German Historical School, which pitted historical specificity, and particularly the nexus between cultural, legal, and economic norms, against the emerging formalism of the Austrian School and the laissez-faire dogmatism of the Manchester School. In retrospect, the founders of German social theory appear overly bent on describing historical change as a series of progressive stages of development and civilizational blocks, but we ought to appreciate their precocious interest in the legal framework of economic organization, an interest that today is once again at the heart of the social sciences.

汇票曾经在经济和商业史上占据了傲人的地位。在 19 世纪的德国大学里，经济史是在法律系里教授的。在法国和意大利的学术界，法律史和经济史也是紧密相连的。从这个角度来看，汇票是一个理想的分析对象：学者们对支撑这些汇票的法律和金融安排的性质以及它们的历史演变有很大的分歧，但他们都把汇票从中世纪晚期到 17 世纪的日益复杂化视为欧洲历史上更大变革的征兆。毫无疑问，对汇票历史的介绍是马克斯·韦伯和维尔纳·桑巴特接受的经济史培训的一部分。两人还吸收了德国历史学派的教训，该学派将历史的特殊性，特别是文化、法律和经济规范之间的联系，与奥地利学派的新兴形式主义和曼彻斯特学派的自由放任教条主义对立起来。回过头来看，德国社会理论的创始人似乎过于执着于将历史变化描述为一系列渐进的发展阶段和文明区块，但我们应该赞赏他们对经济组织的法律框架的早熟兴趣，这种兴趣今天再次成为社会科学的核心。

In the mid-twentieth century, business history was still integral to the study of the Renaissance. If the Renaissance was the cradle of modernity, many scholars asked, what role did the development of financial instruments play in that story? And if individualism was an essential trait of modernity, which economic institutions most fostered it? In mining volumes of business correspondence and the bookkeeping registers of Italian merchants, both ordinary and exceptional (the Medici Bank being among the latter), Raymond de Roover devoted particular attention to bills of exchange.3 Few followed in his footsteps, and even fewer matched his ability to paint a broad canvas using minute reconstructions of early banking techniques and intricate theological diatribes about usury and just price. In the meantime, the center of gravity in the economic history of preindustrial Europe began to move away from southern Europe and further along in time. In the process, the sixteenth century slipped under economic historians’ radar, and with it, the golden age of bills of exchange and financial fairs.

在二十世纪中期，商业史仍然是文艺复兴研究的组成部分。如果文艺复兴是现代性的摇篮，许多学者问，金融工具的发展在这个故事中扮演什么角色？如果个人主义是现代性的一个基本特征，哪些经济机构最能促进它的发展？在挖掘意大利普通和特殊商人（美第奇银行属于后者）的商业信函和簿记登记册时，雷蒙德·德·罗弗对汇票给予了特别关注。3很少有人追随他的脚步，更少有人能与他的能力相提并论，即利用对早期银行技术的细微重建和对高利贷和公正价格的复杂神学论述来描绘一幅广阔的画卷。与此同时，前工业化欧洲经济史的重心开始从欧洲南部，并在时间上进一步移动。在这个过程中，16 世纪从经济史学家的雷达下溜走了，随之而来的是汇票和金融博览会的黄金时代。

In North America in the past fifty years, economic history has migrated from history to economics departments (although recently this trend has been partially reversed). Among economists, economic historians are a minority, and those interested in preindustrial Europe are an even tinier group. Large-scale datasets suitable for statistical treatment are a near-requirement in the discipline but are harder to come by or to construct for earlier periods. To the extent that the military and fiscal expansion of Europe in the sixteenth century remains a subject of inquiry, it is studied via secondary sources. For the brave few who still venture into the archives, the pressure to identify antecedents to present-day financial institutions means that the public debt and stock markets of northern Europe are better-trodden paths of scholarship than bills of exchange.4

在过去的五十年中，北美的经济史已经从历史系迁移到了经济学系（尽管最近这一趋势已经部分逆转）。在经济学家中，经济史学家是少数，而对工业化前的欧洲感兴趣的人更是一个小群体。适合统计学处理的大规模数据集是该学科的一个近乎必要的条件，但对于较早的时期，却很难得到或构建。就欧洲在 16 世纪的军事和财政扩张仍然是一个调查的主题而言，它是通过二手资料来研究的。对于那些仍然敢于进入档案馆的少数人来说，确定当今金融机构的前身的压力意味着北欧的公共债务和股票市场是比汇票更好走的学术之路。4

Meanwhile, social scientists’ propensity to measure economic indicators such as wages, stock prices, and tax revenues has been coupled with a renewed interest in culture as a causal motor of change. In some areas, notably the study of technological innovation, that interest had never faded. But in others, the affirmation of rational choice theory as the dominant interpretative paradigm in the social sciences had expunged culture from the list of variables to be taken into consideration when analyzing the causes of past economic growth and decline. Even as interest in cultural determinants resurfaces, however, disciplinary and methodological balkanization between humanistic and social scientific research persists and has even created new chasms in the very terrain where one could in principle expect greater collaboration. Economists and political scientists are comfortable with a static notion of cultural blocks (e.g., Europe vs. China, Latin Europe vs. the Islamic world, Catholics vs. Protestants) that is anathema to historians and tend to emphasize persistence rather than change over time.5 Naturally, this is not the type of scholarship that would call attention to a seemingly idiosyncratic narrative like the legend of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange.

同时，社会科学家在衡量工资、股票价格和税收等经济指标的倾向性的同时，对文化作为变革的因果动力也重新产生了兴趣。在某些领域，特别是对技术创新的研究，这种兴趣从未消退过。但在其他领域，理性选择理论作为社会科学的主流解释范式得到了肯定，在分析过去经济增长和衰退的原因时，文化被从变量清单中删除。然而，即使对文化决定因素的兴趣再次出现，人文研究和社会科学研究之间的学科和方法论的僵化仍然存在，甚至在人们原则上可以期待更多合作的领域里产生了新的鸿沟。经济学家和政治学家对文化区块的静态概念（例如，欧洲与中国，拉丁欧洲与伊斯兰世界，天主教徒与新教徒）感到很舒服，而这对历史学家来说是一种耻辱，他们倾向于强调持久性而不是随时间的变化。5自然，这不是那种会叫人注意像犹太人发明汇票的传说这样的看似特立独行的叙事的学术研究。

The history of economic thought has experienced its own mutations and in the process has sidelined the kind of questions that would lead us to pay attention to a legend like this. With a few exceptions, found mostly in Marxist-leaning citadels, the history of economic thought is no longer part of the mandatory curricula of economics doctoral programs and is taught in only a handful of history departments in North America. The marginalization of the field has had some refreshing effects, including the broadening of the range of texts and authors that now come under its purview. All in all, however, this rejuvenation has not affected all areas of inquiry equally: the Middle Ages and the sixteenth century have largely been relegated to the periphery, while the Enlightenment and eighteenth-century political economy have come to occupy center stage. The impetus for this resurgence of interest owes a great deal to influential works of the Cambridge School. Yet these works give primacy to politics over the economy, and consequently, the focus has shifted to public finance or the balance of trade at the expense of credit instruments that wove together the everyday lives of ordinary people and private entrepreneurs.6

经济思想史经历了它自己的变异，在这个过程中，那些会导致我们关注这样一个传说的问题被搁置了。除了少数例外，主要是在倾向于马克思主义的堡垒，经济思想史不再是经济学博士课程的必修课，在北美只有少数历史系教授。该领域的边缘化，产生了一些令人耳目一新的效果，包括扩大了现在属于其范围的文本和作者的范围。然而，总的来说，这种复兴并没有平等地影响到所有的研究领域：中世纪和十六世纪在很大程度上被归入边缘，而启蒙运动和十八世纪的政治经济学则占据了中心舞台。这种兴趣复苏的动力在很大程度上归功于剑桥学派的有影响力的作品。然而，这些作品将政治置于经济之上，因此，重点转移到了公共财政或贸易平衡上，而忽略了交织着普通人和私营企业家日常生活的信贷工具。6

Because moral theologians and canon lawyers who debated usury were also among the major economic theorists before 1600, the thinning of scholarly work on the economic history and history of economic thought of that period during the second half of the twentieth century has meant fewer opportunities for mainstream historians of early modern Europe to encounter scholarship on Christian debates about Jews and usury. Meanwhile, the growing affirmation of Jewish history as a legitimate academic subject with its own separate institutional infrastructure, a phenomenon seen especially in North America, has tended to widen rather than narrow the gap between its practitioners and historians of Europe. Admittedly, one can count on one’s hand the early modern Jewish authors, such as the Amsterdam merchant-turned-philosophe Isaac de Pinto, who engaged in conversation with non-Jewish writers regarding the place of commerce in politics and society. But the elision of Jewish topics from the history of early modern European economic thought and economic history is first and foremost the result of the segmentation of academic fields— a tendency this book has sought to combat.

由于辩论高利贷的道德神学家和教会律师也是 1600 年以前的主要经济理论家，在 20 世纪下半叶，关于该时期的经济史和经济思想史的学术工作日渐稀少，这意味着早期现代欧洲的主流历史学家遇到关于犹太人和高利贷的基督教辩论的学术研究的机会较少。同时，犹太历史作为一个合法的学术科目，拥有自己独立的机构基础设施，这种现象在北美尤其明显，它倾向于扩大而不是缩小其从业者与欧洲历史学家之间的差距。诚然，人们可以用手指数出早期现代犹太作家，如阿姆斯特丹商人转行的哲学家艾萨克·德·平托，他与非犹太作家就商业在政治和社会中的地位进行了对话。但是，犹太人的话题在早期现代欧洲经济思想史和经济史中被忽略了，这首先是学术领域分割的结果 —— 这也是本书试图打击的一种倾向。

A bit more needs to be said about both the fate of economic history and the fate of the legend itself among scholars of European Jewry. To start, we ought to recognize that economic history has long had a mixed reputation among Jewish scholars. The first grand narrative of Jewish history to displace the primacy of religion and foreground a sociological approach was the work of the Russian Jewish scholar and advocate Simon Dubnow (1860–1941).7 In the interwar period, the doyen of twentieth-century Jewish historians, Salo W. Baron (1895–1989), completed the first version of his massive and massively influential history of the Jews from antiquity to the modern age. Titled A Social and Religious History of the Jews , it devoted limited space to economic phenomena.8 In 1942, Baron called for a “dispassionate examination of the historic relationships between modern capitalism and the Jews,” yet his own broad sketch was more intent on stressing the detrimental effects of “individualism and materialism” on Jewish tradition than on producing the kind of “dispassionate examination” he advocated.9

关于经济史的命运和传说本身在欧洲犹太人学者中的命运，还需要多说一点。首先，我们应该认识到，经济史在犹太学者中长期以来声誉不佳。第一个取代宗教的首要地位并将社会学方法置于首位的犹太历史宏大叙事是俄罗斯犹太学者和倡导者西蒙·杜伯诺（1860-1941）的作品。7在战时，二十世纪犹太历史学家的元老萨洛-W-巴伦（Salo W·Baron，1895-1989）完成了他从古代到现代的大规模、影响巨大的犹太人历史的第一个版本。题为《犹太人的社会和宗教史》，它用有限的篇幅介绍了经济现象。81942 年，巴伦呼吁对 “现代资本主义和犹太人之间的历史关系进行冷静的审视”，然而他自己广泛的，更倾向于强调 “个人主义和物质主义” 对犹太传统的不利影响，而不是产生他所倡导的那种 “冷静的审视”。9

In the aftermath of World War II, few were ready to pick up Baron’s undertaking where he had left it. The prominence of economic themes in the murderous persecutions of Jews carried out by totalitarian regimes in the mid-twentieth century made most Jewish scholars wary of delving into the subject. A general discomfort surrounded the scholarly treatment of all economic activities by Jews, and the commercial roles Jews played in premodern Europe in particular.10 As a result, the four decades after the Holocaust were not a period of innovation in the field of Jewish economic history. To the extent that Zionist historians were interested in the topic, they turned to agriculture and industrialization as the two defining phenomena of past and modern Jewish societies. The standard narrative remained the same: only under the mounting pressure of persecution after the destruction of the Second Temple in 70 CE had Jews flocked to commerce, an activity in which they came to excel not because of innate characteristics but because of a lack of alternative opportunities.

在二战结束后，很少有人准备接过巴伦的事业，因为他已经离开了。二十世纪中期，极权主义政权对犹太人进行的谋杀性迫害中，经济主题的突出地位使大多数犹太学者对深入研究这一主题保持警惕。学术界对犹太人的所有经济活动，尤其是犹太人在前现代欧洲所扮演的商业角色的处理，普遍存在着一种不适感。10因此，大屠杀之后的四十年并不是犹太经济史领域的创新时期。就犹太复国主义历史学家对这个话题感兴趣而言，他们把农业和工业化作为过去和现代犹太社会的两个决定性现象。标准的叙述仍然是：只有在公元 70 年第二座圣殿被毁后迫害的压力越来越大的情况下，犹太人才会涌向商业，他们在这项活动中表现出色，不是因为先天的特点，而是因为缺乏其他机会。

This was the consensus that Jewish historians took for granted when they wrestled with the possibility that Jews might have invented bills of exchange, a claim that cut both ways: it valorized Jews’ resilience in the face of inauspicious external circumstances, but it also risked casting them as perennial and omnipotent merchants. At the turn of the twentieth century, The Jewish Encyclopedia , the English-language monument to the recent achievements of Jewish scholarship, relayed the views of those who ascribed to Jews the invention of bills of exchange, but it gave more credence to the idea that Muslim traders devised these financial instruments in the eighth century and that Italian merchants later perfected them.11 In the 1930s, Baron had no doubt that “the vital innovations of paper currency, international bills of exchange, the stock exchange, etc., reveal little, if any, Jewish influence in their early stages.”12

这是犹太历史学家在讨论犹太人可能发明了汇票这一可能性时理所当然的共识，这种说法具有两面性：它赞扬了犹太人在面对不吉利的外部环境时的韧性，但也有可能将他们塑造成常年无所不能的商人。在二十世纪之交，《犹太百科全书》（The Jewish Encyclopedia），这座展示犹太学术界最新成就的英文纪念碑，转述了那些将汇票的发明归功于犹太人的观点，但它更相信穆斯林商人在八世纪设计了这些金融工具，意大利商人后来完善了它们。11在 20 世纪 30 年代，巴伦毫不怀疑，“纸币、国际汇票、证券交易所等重要的创新，在其早期阶段几乎没有显示出犹太人的影响”。12

The authoritativeness of Baron’s statement did not mean that lay and academic Jewish audiences ceased to come across the legend of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange. In a pioneering history of the Jews of his native Thessaloniki, Isaac Samuel Emmanuel (1896–1972), a German-educated historian and ordained rabbi, connected the tale with his ancestors: in his telling, bills of exchange had been invented by Jews fleeing Spain in 1492, who hid those pieces of paper in their prayer books and were thus able to save a great deal of their assets.13 With Sephardic Jews still occupying a marginal position in Jewish academic institutions, this further elaboration of the legend did not gain traction.

巴伦声明的权威性并不意味着非专业和学术界的犹太观众不再接触到犹太人发明汇票的传说。在他的家乡塞萨洛尼基的一部开创性的犹太人历史中，艾萨克·塞缪尔·伊曼纽尔（1896-1972），一位受过德国教育的历史学家和受戒的拉比，将这个故事与他的祖先联系起来：在他的讲述中，汇票是 1492 年逃离西班牙的犹太人发明的，他们将这些纸片藏在祈祷书中，从而能够保存大量的资产。13由于塞法尔犹太人在犹太学术机构中仍处于边缘地位，对这一传说的进一步阐述并没有得到支持。

It was Montesquieu’s version of the legend that enlisted the most supporters and detractors. In a fast-paced lecture in London on the emancipation of European Jewry and the rise of capitalism, the renowned book collector, scholar, and polymath Chimen Abramsky (1916–2010) took the time to debunk Montesquieu’s idea and explain instead that “Lombard merchants and bankers” had introduced bills of exchange.14 When Shmuel Ettinger (1919–1988), a lapsed communist and secular Zionist professor of history at Hebrew University, painted the economic history of Jews in broad strokes in a brief essay, he greatly downplayed the link between commerce and emancipation, but even he could not resist relaying Montesquieu’s exaltation of Jews’ financial skills as rare praise amid the generally unsympathetic Enlightenment treatment of the Jews.15 Ettinger was not the only faculty member in Jerusalem who incorporated the legend into his teaching and writing. In the 1960s, a student at Hebrew University could still be taught that medieval Jews invented bills of exchange as part of the narrative that celebrated Jews’ outstanding commercial skills as a form of survival in adverse circumstances.16

正是孟德斯鸠版本的传奇征集了最多的支持者和诋毁者。在伦敦举行的关于欧洲犹太人解放和资本主义兴起的快节奏讲座中，著名的图书收藏家、学者和多面手奇门·阿布拉姆斯基（1916-2010）花时间驳斥了孟德斯鸠的观点，而是解释说 “伦巴第商人和银行家” 引入了汇票。14当希伯来大学历史系教授、失效的共产主义者史米尔·埃廷格（Shmuel Ettinger）（1919-1988）在一篇简短的文章中大笔一挥地描绘犹太人的经济历史时，他大大淡化了商业和解放之间的联系，但即使是他也忍不住转述孟德斯鸠对犹太人金融技能的赞美，在启蒙运动对犹太人普遍缺乏同情心的待遇中，这是一种罕见的赞扬。15埃廷格并不是耶路撒冷唯一将这一传说纳入其教学和写作的教员。在 20 世纪 60 年代，希伯来大学的学生仍然可以被教导说，中世纪的犹太人发明了汇票，作为颂扬犹太人杰出的商业技能作为在恶劣环境中生存的一种形式的叙述的一部分。16

It took an outsider to shatter the historiographical consensus. In his European Jewry in the Age of Mercantalism, 1550–1750 , first published in 1985, Jonathan Israel focuses on Sombart’s post-1492 chronology but rejects his framework entirely by attributing the reversal of the fortunes of both eastern and western European Jews in the period between 1550 and 1713 to the “political and spiritual upheaval which engulfed European culture as a whole at the end of the sixteenth century.”17 Israel’s wide-ranging synthesis aims to show that a singular convergence of the doctrines of toleration that emerged from the French Wars of Religion, the surge of interest in the Hebrew Bible among Christian scholars, and new economic policies designed to attract Jews and other foreign merchants to Christian communities in order to boost commerce favored Jews’ reintegration into parts of Europe from which they had been expelled in the Middle Ages. Not any inherent facility with money, but a tendency to adapt to local structures they could not control led Jews to take up different economic roles in different regions of the Continent: in western Europe, Sephardim seized opportunities created by sweeping maritime empires; in central Europe, a few wealthy financiers negotiated privileges for fellow Jews in exchange for providing princes with the resources and services they needed to fund their war efforts; in the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth, absentee feudal lords relied on Jews to tend to their estates. When political and economic conditions in each region changed, so did the economic profile of the Jews there.

一个局外人打破了历史学界的共识。乔纳森·伊斯雷尔（Jonathan Israel）在 1985 年首次出版的《重商主义时代的欧洲犹太人》（European Jewry in the Age of Mercantalism, 1550-1750）中，关注桑巴特的 1492 年后年表，但完全拒绝了他的框架，将 1550 至 1713 年期间东欧和西欧犹太人命运的逆转归咎于 “十六世纪末席卷整个欧洲文化的政治和精神动荡”。17伊斯雷尔广泛的综述旨在表明，法国宗教战争中出现的宽容学说、基督教学者对希伯来圣经兴趣的激增以及旨在吸引犹太人和其他外国商人到基督教社区以促进商业的新经济政策的奇特融合，有利于犹太人重新融入他们在中世纪被驱逐出的欧洲部分。犹太人并非天生善于理财，而是倾向于适应他们无法控制的当地结构，因此他们在欧洲大陆的不同地区扮演了不同的经济角色：在西欧，塞法尔迪姆人抓住了席卷而来的海洋帝国所创造的机会；在中欧，少数富有的金融家通过谈判为犹太人同伴提供特权，以换取为王子们提供他们在战争中需要的资源和服务；在波兰·立陶宛联邦，缺席的封建领主依靠犹太人来打理他们的庄园。当，每个地区的政治和经济条件发生变化时，那里的犹太人的经济状况也发生了变化。

Although Israel does not discuss the commercial techniques utilized by Jewish merchants and brokers, he implies that these individuals conformed to the forms of business organization that prevailed in the surrounding societies. Obviously, there is no place in his approach for the legend or any other special ties between Jews and bills of exchange. Nor does he feel the need to mention Sombart. His goal is to weave Jewish history into the fabric of European history, not to confine it to a separate sphere. In Israel’s perspective, the singularities of the Jewish experience serve to illuminate broader dynamics that affected early modern Europe at large and offer grounds for further comparisons more than they are significant in and of themselves.

虽然以色列没有讨论犹太商人和经纪人所使用的商业技术，但他暗示这些人符合周围社会中普遍存在的商业组织形式。显然，在他的方法中没有关于犹太人和汇票之间的传说或任何其他特殊联系的位置。他也不觉得有必要提及 Sombart。他的目标是将犹太历史编织到欧洲历史的结构中，而不是将其限制在一个单独的领域。在伊斯雷尔看来，犹太人经历的独特性有助于阐明影响整个早期现代欧洲的更广泛的动态，并为进一步的比较提供依据，而不是它们本身就很重要。

This disregard for Sombart, however, has been far from universal. At the turn of the twenty-first century, the old discomfort toward economic history has given way to a spike in interest in the subject among historians of past Jewish societies.18 And with it, Sombart has been resurrected, alternatively as the dead horse that still needs beating or as a hidden muse. Breaking the usual reticence that many display in broaching the subject of Jews and capitalism, some scholars today justify their approach in relation to Sombart, and others even find redeeming qualities in his work. Yuri Slezkine joins a long line of thinkers for whom “the Jews epitomize Western civilization—as its original creators, best practitioners, and rightful beneficiaries.”19 At the same time, for fear that these assertions might be misconstrued, he distances himself from Sombart.20 In a prize-winning book, two economists, Maristella Botticini and Zvi Eckstein, argue that the compulsory religious education of Jewish men transformed Jewish society from an agricultural to a commercial one during the first millennium and a half of the Common Era. Their approach is reminiscent of Sombart’s in two respects: it downplays persecution as an explanatory factor and stresses the persistence of Jewish cultural traits across time and space.21 In a recent essay, Adam Sutcliffe recounts the controversies surrounding the publication of The Jews and Economic Life in 1911 and situates the work in the intellectual climate of the time but also urges us not to dismiss Sombart too easily, suggesting that he was neither “as straightforwardly hostile [to Jews] as many critics have assumed” nor “altogether wrong.”22

然而，这种对桑巴特的漠视远非普遍现象。在 21 世纪之交，过去对经济史的不适已经让位于过去犹太社会的历史学家对这一主题的兴趣激增。18随之而来的是，桑巴特被复活了，他可以作为一匹仍然需要被打的死马，也可以作为一个隐藏的缪斯。今天，一些学者打破了许多人在探讨犹太人和资本主义这一主题时表现出的通常的缄默，为他们与桑巴特有关的研究方法进行了辩护，还有一些学者甚至在他的作品中发现了一些值得称赞的品质。尤里·斯列兹金（Yuri Slezkine）加入了一长串思想家的行列，对他们来说，“犹太人是西方文明的缩影 —— 作为其最初的创造者、最佳实践者和合法的受益者”。19同时，由于担心这些论断可能被误解，他与桑巴特保持距离。20在一本获奖的书中，两位经济学家玛丽斯特拉·博蒂奇尼（Maristella Botticini）和兹维·埃克斯坦（Zvi Eckstein）认为，在公元前一千年半的时间里，犹太男子的强制性宗教教育将犹太社会从农业社会转变为商业社会。他们的方法在两个方面让人想起了桑巴特的方法：它淡化了迫害这一解释因素，并强调了犹太人的文化特征在时间和空间上的持久性。21在最近的一篇文章中，亚当·萨特克利夫（Adam Sutcliffe）讲述了围绕 1911 年《犹太人与经济生活》出版的争议，并将该作品置于当时的知识氛围中，但也敦促我们不要轻易否定桑巴特，认为他既不像许多批评家所认为的那样直接敌视犹太人，也不是 “完全错误”。22

The partial rehabilitation of Sombart, whose “filtration with fascist ideology after World War I” was until recently deemed to have “irreparably tarnished his reputation,” is perplexing.23 If the goal is to revitalize interest in economic themes among scholars of past Jewish societies, Sombart is not the right starting point. The Jews and Economic Life should be read as a flawed empirical account and as a chapter in modern intellectual history, not as an imperfect model.24 Sombart’s insistence on the unusual economic occupational structure of most postexilic Jewish societies was nothing new at the time of its publication, and his explanations for this phenomenon were indefensible even by the standards of historical inquiry in his day.

桑巴特的部分恢复是令人困惑的，他的 “法西斯意识形态在第一次世界大战后的过滤” 直到最近才被认为 “不可挽回地玷污了他的声誉”。23如果目标是重振过去犹太社会的学者对经济主题的兴趣，那么桑巴特并不是正确的出发点。犹太人和经济生活》应该作为一个有缺陷的经验性描述和现代思想史上的一个章节来阅读，而不是作为一个不完美的模型。24桑巴特坚持认为大多数后世犹太人社会的经济职业结构不寻常，这在该书出版时并不新鲜，而他对这一现象的解释即使按照他那个时代的历史调查标准也是站不住脚的。

Extreme as he was, Sombart was also the heir to a long tradition of referencing (more or less imaginary) Jews in order to make arguments for (and more often against) capitalism—to gloss once more the subtitle of Albert Hirschman’s influential work The Passions and the Interests: Political Arguments for Capitalism Before Its Triumph , this time putting the emphasis on Arguments .25 This long tradition was already fading when Hirschman detected one of its traces. In 1977, his evocation of Montesquieu’s version of the legend of the Jewish invention of bills of exchange briefly revived positive receptions of that tale and incorporated it into an argument about the future of modern capitalism and democracy that was more uplifting than the one articulated by Sombart. But the reference to Montesquieu’s tale of Jewish inventiveness and survival fell on deaf ears, as the many readers of The Passions and the Interests did not recognize the legend’s complicated history and significance.

桑巴特虽然极端，但他也是一个长期传统的继承者，即引用（或多或少是想象中的）犹太人来为资本主义提出论据（更多时候是反对） —— 再次粉饰阿尔伯特·赫斯曼有影响力的作品《激情与利益》的副标题。激情与利益：资本主义胜利前的政治论证》，这次把重点放在论证上。25当赫希曼发现它的一个痕迹时，这个漫长的传统已经在消退。1977 年，他唤起了孟德斯鸠版本的犹太人发明汇票的传说，短暂地恢复了人们对这个故事的积极接受，并将其纳入关于现代资本主义和民主的未来的论证中，这比桑巴特阐述的论证更令人振奋。但对孟德斯鸠关于犹太人的创造力和生存的故事的提及却被置若罔闻，因为《激情与利益》的许多读者并不了解这个传说的复杂历史和意义。

This example is indicative of a larger phenomenon: the decline in invocations of figures of Jews as forms of social and political critique. As I write these pages, antisemitism in the United States and especially in Europe is again on the rise, and insidious references to domineering Jewish capitalists—references that in some cases translate into hostile actions—are not confined to the fringes of media and society. Meanwhile, Islam has begun to provide another foil against which the West defines itself, primarily among the political Right, but even in sectors of the Left. Today as in the past, antisemitism and Islamophobia are neither mutually exclusive nor necessarily in competition with one another; in fact, they coexist in locally distinctive forms, particularly across parts of Europe, where images of Jews and Muslims are sometimes used interchangeably in debates about credibility, integrity, and civic loyalty.26 But if Hirschman’s reference to the legend of bills of exchange could be so easily disregarded, it is also because, thanks to meaningful changes in attitudes and to a new awareness of the power of language to cause harm, representations of Jews are no longer a preferred vehicle for mainstream Western culture, let alone scholars, to express their deepest worries and aspirations.

这个例子说明了一个更大的现象：援引犹太人的形象作为社会和政治批判的形式在减少。在我写这几页的时候，美国，特别是欧洲的反犹太主义再次抬头，对专横的犹太资本家的阴险提及 —— 在某些情况下，这些提及会转化为敌对行动 —— 并不局限于媒体和社会的边缘地带。同时，伊斯兰教已经开始提供另一个陪衬，西方人主要是在政治右派中，但甚至在左派中也是这样定义自己。今天和过去一样，反犹太主义和伊斯兰恐惧症既不相互排斥，也不一定相互竞争；事实上，它们以当地独特的形式共存，特别是在欧洲部分地区，在关于可信度、诚信和公民忠诚度的辩论中，犹太人和穆斯林的形象有时可以互换使用。26但是，如果赫希曼对汇票传说的提及可以如此轻易地被忽视，那也是因为，由于态度的有意义的变化和对语言造成伤害的力量的新认识，对犹太人的表述不再是西方主流文化的首选工具，更不用说学者们，来表达他们最深切的担忧和愿望。

By contrast, as this book has shown, that habit of mind was not only pervasive in the Middle Ages and at the height of racist antisemitism in modern Europe but also widespread in the post-Reformation period, that is, at the very time when European merchant culture is generally assumed to have begun to free itself from religious dictates. By establishing an intimate connection between Jews and bills of exchange, the legend did not censure all commercial pursuits. Rather, it reworked ingrained images of Jews as trickster lenders and disloyal subjects of Christian rulers who were capable of siphoning wealth out of the realm. In so doing, it projected onto imaginary figures generalized fears that the transformation of bills of exchange into both ordinary and incredibly complex operations made more and more acute in the course of the sixteenth and early seventeenth centuries.

相比之下，正如本书所示，这种思维习惯不仅在中世纪和现代欧洲的种族主义反犹太主义的高峰期普遍存在，而且在宗教改革后的时期也很普遍，也就是说，正是在欧洲商人文化被普遍认为已经开始摆脱宗教的支配时。通过建立犹太人和汇票之间的密切联系，这个传说并没有谴责所有的商业追求。相反，它重塑了犹太人根深蒂固的形象，即他们是诡计多端的放贷者，是基督教统治者的不忠臣民，能够从王国中抽走财富。这样一来，它就把普遍的恐惧投射到了想象中的人物身上，而在 16 世纪和 17 世纪初，汇票转变为普通和令人难以置信的复杂操作，使得这种恐惧越来越强烈。

The putative Jewish invention of these bills became a way of addressing questions about the increasing abstraction of credit relations, the beneficial and corrupting consequences of their expansion, the limits of regulatory institutions, and even the nature of political power. Although not as autonomous from state financial policies as Bitcoins claim to be today, bills of exchange were primarily an instrument of private finance. They represented the ability of far-flung merchants to move funds, speculate on currency arbitrage, and potentially subvert states’ and empires’ monetary policies. In the 100 years before the French Revolution, they also became a fairly common form of payment among men and, to a lesser extent, women whose financial literacy was not always commensurate with the complexity of the speculative schemes into which they entered. During the nineteenth century, as new capitalist institutions from the factory to the corporation displaced commercial credit as the primary subjects of cultural and political struggle, the legend lost its immediacy as a moral tale and entered a new chapter of its existence as a pseudo-fact at the heart of influential accounts of the historical trajectory of Western capitalism.

这些票据的所谓犹太发明成为解决以下问题的一种方式：信贷关系的日益抽象化，其扩张的有益和腐败后果，监管机构的局限性，甚至是政治权力的性质。尽管不像比特币今天声称的那样可以独立于国家金融政策，但汇票主要是一种私人融资工具。它们代表了远方的商人转移资金、投机货币套利的能力，并有可能颠覆国家和帝国的货币政策。在法国大革命之前的 100 年里，它们也成为男性和在较小程度上女性的一种相当普遍的支付方式，这些人的金融知识并不总是与他们所参与的投机计划的复杂性相称的。在 19 世纪，随着从工厂到公司的新资本主义机构取代商业信贷成为文化和政治斗争的主要对象，这个传说失去了其作为道德故事的直接性，作为西方资本主义历史轨迹的有影响力的描述的核心的一个伪事实，进入了它存在的新篇章。

There are many reasons why representations of Jews—and specifically of Jews’ alleged ways of handling money in the late Middle Ages—have had such an incredible pull on European authors of the most diverse dispositions and backgrounds. At bottom, all those representations have something in common: the assumption that historically, Jews behaved in the marketplace according to attributes that defined them outside of the marketplace. Not everyone agreed on what those attributes were and whether they were immutable or reformable. That is why we have encountered a plurality of representations of Jews and their economic roles, even if the most persistent was that of a devious Jewish usurer hiding behind an honest façade, ready to exploit credulous and upright Christian borrowers. The ubiquity of this image was a measure of the pull of the fantasy that market society, before and after it was called capitalism, might be constructed as a neutral zone, one unaffected by outside influences and where only those forces generated within market exchanges themselves meet and clash on a level playing field.

关于犹太人的描述 —— 特别是关于犹太人在中世纪晚期所谓的处理金钱的方式 —— 对具有最不同倾向和背景的欧洲作者有如此大的吸引力，原因有很多。从根本上说，所有这些描述都有一个共同点：假设历史上犹太人在市场上的行为是根据市场之外的属性来定义的。并非每个人都同意这些属性是什么，以及它们是否是不可改变的或可改革的。这就是为什么我们遇到了关于犹太人及其经济角色的多种表现形式，即使最持久的是一个狡猾的犹太高利贷者躲在诚实的外表下，准备剥削可信的、正直的基督徒借款人。这一形象的无处不在是幻想的一种措施，即市场社会，在它被称为资本主义之前和之后，可能被构建为一个中立的区域，一个不受外界影响的区域，只有那些在市场交换本身产生的力量在一个公平的竞争环境中相遇和冲突。

All the authors we have read and interrogated throughout this book wrestled with variations of the same question: How do legal, economic, and symbolic hierarchies that precede one’s entry into a financial transaction with someone from outside one’s immediate circle affect those transactions? By the seventeenth century, certain European governments had designed regimes of toleration that promised to treat Jewish merchants like all other merchants with regard to their trading and banking activities. Later, emancipation lifted all legal restrictions on Jewish men operating in the market. Different as these historical moments were, they both produced a more egalitarian structure within which Jewish economic actors could interact with non-Jews. Yet figures of Jews that owed more to long discursive traditions than to real-life struggles stripped even these more egalitarian forms of coexistence of their full meaning. That is why the ease with which Jews have been perceived as at once invisible and distinctive, marginal and yet centrally disruptive, ought to be part of how we understand the development of Western commercial society.

在本书中，我们所阅读和询问的所有作者都在为同一个问题的变化而努力。在一个人与他周围的人进行金融交易之前，法律、经济和象征性的等级制度是如何影响这些交易的？到 17 世纪，某些欧洲政府设计了宽容制度，承诺在贸易和银行活动方面像对待所有其他商人一样对待犹太商人。后来，解放制度解除了对犹太男子在市场上经营的所有法律限制。尽管这些历史时刻不同，但它们都产生了一个更加平等的结构，在这个结构中，犹太经济行为者可以与非犹太人互动。然而，犹太人的形象更多地归功于长期的话语传统，而不是现实生活中的斗争，甚至剥夺了这些更加平等的共存形式的全部意义。这就是为什么犹太人被视为既无形又独特，既边缘化又具有核心破坏性的容易程度，应该成为我们理解西方商业社会发展的一部分。

APPENDIX 1

Early Modern European Commercial Literature

早期现代欧洲商业文学

PRINTED BIBLIOGR APHIES AND ONLINE DATABASES

印刷书目和在线数据库

A SPECIALIST OF SIXTEENTH-CENTURY western European merchants, the late Pierre Jeannin launched a laudable project at a time when historians still took notes on 6 × 8 index cards: an inventory of all economic treatises and manuals printed in Europe during the early modern period. Thanks to the collaboration of two colleagues, Jochen Hoock and Wolfgang Kaiser, the first volumes of this ongoing project have appeared, covering the period up to 1700. Jeannin and his collaborators titled their work Ars Mercatoria . By choosing a Latin expression, they gave the impression that they were using early modern terminology. In fact, they turned a rare expression into a staple phrase, at least among specialists. Ars Mercatoria , the art of commerce, is a felicitous title because it is capacious: it captures the amorphous bounda·ries of the literature it seeks to map in ways other modern terms, such as “economic treatises” or “manuals,” cannot.1 Bulky and only available in the traditional form of the bounded book, these volumes are an invaluable source: while expensive, their cost is not prohibitive; they are present in many libraries and can be ordered even by those with access only to interlibrary loan; and, most important of all, they list the library holdings of each bibliographical item. I have consulted them many times but could not rely on them alone in writing this book because at present they do not go beyond the year 1700.

作为六十年代西欧商人的专家，已故的 Pierre Jeannin 在历史学家还在用 6×8 的索引卡做笔记的时候，发起了一个值得称赞的项目：清点现代早期欧洲印刷的所有经济论文和手册。由于两位同事 Jochen Hoock 和 Wolfgang Kaiser 的合作，这个正在进行的项目的第一卷已经出现，涵盖了 1700 年之前的时期。杰宁和他的合作者将他们的工作命名为Ars Mercatoria。通过选择拉丁语表达，他们给人的印象是他们使用的是早期现代术语。事实上，他们把一个罕见的表达方式变成了一个主要的短语，至少在专家中是这样。Ars Mercatoria，即商业的艺术，是一个很好的标题，因为它很有容量：它以其他现代术语，如 “经济论文” 或 “手册”，无法捕捉到它所要描绘的文学的无定界。1这些书体积庞大，而且只有装订成册的传统形式，但它们是一种宝贵的资源：虽然价格昂贵，但成本并不高；许多图书馆都有这些书，甚至那些只能通过图书馆间借阅的图书馆也可以订购；而且，最重要的是，它们列出了每个书目在图书馆的库存。我曾多次查阅它们，但在编写本书时不能仅仅依靠它们，因为目前它们没有超过 1700 年的内容。

Far smaller and partial, but also handier and more accessible, is the corpus of “economic bestsellers” published in Europe before 1800 redacted by Kenneth E. Carpenter, the former librarian of the Harvard Business School’s Kress Library of Business and Economics (now part of Baker Library). This list identifies forty titles of political economy, published between 1588 and 1848, primarily in English, French, German, Spanish, and Italian, on the basis of the estimated number of editions published in the original language and in translation. It is an eclectic list, one that begins with Bernardo Davanzati’s Lezione delle monete and ends with Karl Marx’s Manifesto , and excludes “practical works of the how-to-do-it” variety, such as Jacques Savary’s Parfait négociant .2 I made little use of this catalogue because of the few titles it includes and its a priori division between high-and low-brow economic bestsellers. Sophus Reinert, by contrast, relied entirely on Carpenter’s corpus for his analysis of the canon of European political economy and its translation from one language to another; consequently, he also omitted the less canonical handbooks that I considered here.3

由哈佛大学商学院克雷斯商业和经济学图书馆（现为贝克图书馆的一部分）前馆长肯尼思- E·Carpenter 编辑的 1800 年以前在欧洲出版的 “经济畅销书” 语料库要小得多，也不全面，但也更方便，更容易查阅。这份清单根据原文和翻译版本的估计数量，确定了 1588 年至 1848 年期间出版的 40 种政治经济学书籍，主要是英语、法语、德语、西班牙语和意大利语。这是一份不拘一格的清单，从贝尔纳多·达万扎蒂的Lezione delle monete开始，到卡尔·马克思的《宣言》结束，不包括 “如何做” 的实用作品，如雅克·萨瓦里的Parfait négociant。2我很少使用这个目录，因为它包括的书很少，而且它先验地划分了高低级别的经济畅销书。相比之下，Sophus Reinert 完全依靠 Carpenter 的语料库来分析欧洲政治经济学的典范及其从一种语言到另一种语言的翻译；因此，他也省略了我在这里考虑的那些不太典范的手册。3

Given the focus of this book, I should mention one more traditional scholarly work: Jean-Claude Perrot’s pioneering essays on the economic literature published in Old Regime France. Perrot was the first to attempt to quantify the size of this phenomenon, although the basis for his calculations is not always clear.4 Moreover, although he labeled his subject the study of “political economy,” a term coined in 1615 that gained currency in the following century, Perrot covered in detail texts such as Savary’s Parfait négociant and the Savary brothers’ Dictionnaire universel de commerce , which fit neither the contemporary nor the modern definition of “political economy.”5

鉴于本书的重点，我应该提到一个更传统的学术著作。让·克劳德·佩罗（Jean-Claude Perrot）关于在法国旧制度下出版的经济文献的开创性文章。佩罗是第一个试图对这一现象的规模进行量化的人，尽管他的计算依据并不总是很清楚。4此外，尽管他把自己的主题称为 “政治经济学” 研究，这个术语是在 1615 年创造的，并在随后的一个世纪里得到了普及，但佩罗详细介绍了萨瓦里的Parfait négociant和萨瓦里兄弟的Dictionnaire universel de commerce等文本，它们既不符合当代也不符合现代的 “政治经济学” 定义。5

The online database that best succeeds in embracing the wide assortment of publications available to early modern readers, ranging from price sheets to treatises of political economy, merchant manuals, commentaries on maritime law, and more, is The Making of the Modern World . This project began with the digitization of the two largest collections of printed material pertaining to all things economic from the invention of the printing press until the mid-nineteenth century: the Goldsmiths Library of Economic Literature at the University of London and the Kress Collection of Business and Economics at Harvard Business School. Since its creation, it has incorporated additional material from the Seligman Collection of the Butler Library at Columbia University and Sterling Memorial Library at Yale University. It is bound to expand further. As a result, multiple copies of the same title have sometimes been digitized.

The Making of the Modern World是一个在线数据库，它最成功地囊括了早期现代读者可获得的各种出版物，从价格表到政治经济学论文、商人手册、海商法评论等等，都在其中。这个项目始于对两个最大的印刷材料的数字化，这些材料涉及从印刷术发明到 19 世纪中期的所有经济事物：伦敦大学的金史密斯经济文献图书馆和哈佛商学院的克莱斯商业和经济学收藏。自创建以来，它已从哥伦比亚大学巴特勒图书馆的塞利格曼收藏和耶鲁大学的斯特林纪念图书馆吸收了更多材料。它势必会进一步扩大。因此，同一标题的多个副本有时已被数字化。

The main advantage of this database is that it comes closest to capturing the definition of “the economy” as it existed in the minds of the readers and writers of the time. It does not exclude material by subject: everything from demography to trade, finance, agriculture, administration, and law comes under its purview. Nor does it make any formal or hierarchical distinctions between bound books, serial publications, pamphlets, or loose-leaf pages containing pieces of legislation, price lists, and more. Given the expansion of European commerce and colonial rule over this period, it also contains useful, if selective, information about other regions of the world. In short, it does not rely on a preestablished notion of what “the economy” meant at a given time, although its strengths reflect those of the library collections it uses and are thus tilted toward core areas of western Europe.

这个数据库的主要优点是，它最接近于捕捉当时读者和作家心中的 “经济” 定义， 。它没有按主题排除材料：从人口学到贸易、金融、农业、行政管理和法律的所有内容都在其范围内。它也没有对装订成册的书籍、连续出版物、小册子或包含立法、价格表等内容的活页进行任何形式或层次上的区分。鉴于这一时期欧洲商业和殖民统治的扩张，它还包含了关于世界其他地区的有用信息，尽管是选择性的。简而言之，它并不依赖关于 “经济” 在特定时期意味着什么的预先确立的概念，尽管它的优势反映了它所使用的图书馆藏书的优势，并因此向西欧的核心地区倾斜。

The main drawback of this resource is its price. The Making of the Modern World (MMW ) is sold by Gale in three packages (Part 1: 1450–1850 , Part 2: 1851–1914 , and the recently added Part 3: 1890–1945 ). The company’s website shows that in 2015, out of a total of 166 institutional subscribers to at least one of the digital collections produced by Gale, 49 percent were in the United States and 24 percent in Japan. Across Europe there were only twenty-nine institutional subscribers (of which eight were in the United Kingdom and another eight in Switzerland).6 Of the ten universities with the largest endowments in the United States in 2016 (Harvard, Yale, Stanford, Princeton, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, the University of Pennsylvania, Texas A&M–College Station, the University of Michigan–Ann Arbor, Columbia, and Notre Dame), two (Texas A&M–College Station and the University of Pennsylvania) do not subscribe to MMW .7

这一资源的主要缺点是价格。The Making of the Modern World（MMW）由 Gale 公司分三部分出售（第一部分：1450-1850，第二部分：1851-1914，以及最近增加的第三部分：1890-1945）。该公司的网站显示，2015 年，在总共 166 个机构用户中，至少有一个是盖尔公司制作的数字收藏品，其中 49% 在美国，24% 在日本。在整个欧洲，只有 29 家机构用户（其中 8 家在英国，另外 8 家在瑞士）。6在 2016 年美国捐赠最多的十所大学中（哈佛大学、耶鲁大学、斯坦福大学、普林斯顿大学、麻省理工学院、宾夕法尼亚大学、德克萨斯 A&M-College Station、密歇根大学·安娜堡分校、哥伦比亚大学和圣母大学），有两所（德克萨斯 A&M-College Station 和宾夕法尼亚大学）没有订阅MMW。7

Among the other electronic databases that I used most often, three require a subscription: the Early English Books Online (EEBO ) and the Eighteenth-Century Collections Online (ECCO ), both of which only include English-language texts, and the Sabin Americana, 1500–1926 , which, like MMW and ECCO , is also produced by Gale.

在我最常使用的其他电子数据库中，有三个需要订阅：Early English Books Online（EEBO）和Eighteenth-Century Collections Online（ECCO），这两个数据库只包括英语文本，以及Sabin Americana, 1500-1926，与MMW和ECCO一样，也是由 Gale 制作。

To combat the prohibitive costs of for-profit online resources, a number of libraries have partnered to produce open-access platforms that are more functional than Google Books. Particularly relevant to my work is the Hathi Trust Digital Library, which collects millions of digitized books, journals, and other materials (including pilot projects that extend to digital audio and image content, as well as digital-born publications). French rare book material can be accessed via Gallica, which makes available part of the digitized collections of the Bibliothèque Nationale de France, even if it is rather clunky, and the Project for American and French Research on the Treasury of the French Language (ARTFL), which includes several old dictionaries as well as Diderot and D’Alembert’s Encyclopédie and has user-friendly search tools. Artworks, video, and sounds figure more prominently in Europeana Collections, an open-access interface that makes available millions of rare books, images, and other sources from European digital collections.

为了对抗营利性在线资源的高昂成本，一些图书馆已经合作制作了比谷歌图书更实用的开放存取平台。与我的工作特别相关的是 Hathi Trust 数字图书馆，它收集了数以百万计的数字化书籍、期刊和其他材料（包括扩展到数字音频和图像内容的试点项目，以及数字出生的出版物）。法国的珍本图书资料可以通过 Gallica 访问，它提供了法国国家图书馆的部分数字化藏书，尽管它相当笨拙，还有美国和法国研究法语宝库项目（ARTFL），其中包括几本古老的字典以及狄德罗和达朗贝尔的《百科全书》，并有用户友好的搜索工具。艺术品、视频和声音在 Europeana 收藏中的地位更加突出，Europeana 是一个开放的界面，可以提供欧洲数字收藏中的数百万册珍稀书籍、图像和其他资料。

APPENDIX 2

The Legend’s Earliest Formulation

传说的最早期表述

WHAT FOLLOWS IS MY English translation of the text that forms the basis of the legend of the Jewish invention of marine insurance and bills of exchange as it appears in Étienne Cleirac’s 1661 Us et coustumes de la mer . I chose the second rather than the first (1647) edition of this book because it offers an extended version of the legend and because it circulated more widely than the first, as the number of surviving copies in rare book libraries attest. (Today, readers can access both editions online through Gallica.) Note that there exist two prints of the 1661 edition, both issued in Bordeaux, both with the same title and the same pagination. One version has a colored frontispiece and more decorations; it was printed “En la boutique de Millanges chez Guillaume Taupinard, marchand libraire.” The other has a black-and-white frontispiece and fewer decorations; it was printed “Par Iacques Mongiorn Millanges, imprimeur ordinaire du roy.”

以下是我对构成犹太人发明海事保险和汇票传说基础的文本的英译，它出现在艾蒂安·克莱拉克（Étienne Cleirac）1661 年出版的《海洋的用途和习俗》（Us et coustumes de la mer）中。我选择了这本书的第二版而不是第一版（1647），因为它提供了这个传说的扩展版本，而且它比第一版流传得更广，正如珍本图书馆中的存世量所证明的那样。（今天，读者可以通过 Gallica 在线访问这两个版本。）请注意，1661 年版有两个版本，都是在波尔多发行的，都有相同的标题和相同的页码。其中一个版本有一幅彩色的正面插图和更多的装饰；它被印成了 “En la boutique de Millanges chez Guillaume Taupinard, marchand libraire”。另一个版本有一幅黑白的正面插图和较少的装饰；印有 “Par Iacques Mongiorn Millanges, imprimeur ordinaire du roy”。

I have underlined those words and sentences that do not appear in the 1647 edition and were added in 1661. I have retained italics, capital and small letters, and most of the punctuation as they figure in the original. I have chosen to stay as close to the text as possible except when a literal translation would be unintelligible.

我在那些没有出现在 1647 年版本中，而在 1661 年加入的词和句子下划线。我保留了斜体字、大写字母和小写字母，以及大部分标点符号，因为它们在原文中都有。我选择了尽可能地贴近文本，除非直译会让人无法理解。

Source: Estienne Cleirac, Us et coustumes de la mer, divisées en trois parties: I. De la navigation. II. Du commerce naval & contracts maritimes. III. De la i urisdiction de la marine. Avec un traicté des termes de marine & reglemens de la navigation des fleuves & rivieres: le tout reveu, corrigé & augmenté par l’autheur en cette derniere edition (Bordeaux: Millanges, 1661), 217–223.

资料来源：Estienne Cleirac,Us et coustumes de la mer, divisées in trois parties: I·De la navigation.II·海上贸易和海事合同。III·De la i urisdiction de la marine. 附有海军条款和江河航运规则的小册子：作者在最后一版中对其进行了全面修订、纠正和补充（波尔多：Millanges，1661），217-223。

The Standard of the Sea1

海洋的标准1

Chapter 1: On insurance contracts or policies, their definition, their similarities with and differences from other contracts pertaining to maritime affairs. First Article: Insurance is a contract through which one promises the indemnity of the goods that are transported from one country to another, especially when they are transported by sea; and it works by means of a price calculated as a percentage of the insured goods’ value and agreed upon between the insured, who carries the goods or has them transported by a third party, and the insurer, who promises the indemnity.

第一章：关于保险合同或保单，它们的定义，它们与其他有关海事的合同的相似之处和不同之处。第一条。保险是一种合同，通过这种合同，人们承诺对从一个国家运输到另一个国家的货物进行赔偿，特别是当这些货物是通过海上运输的时候；它的运作方式是按照被保险货物价值的百分比计算价格，并由携带货物或由第三方运输货物的被保险人和承诺赔偿的保险人商定。

[CLEIRAC’S COMMENTARY]

克莱拉克的评论

Contractus assecurationis id est avertendi periculi, dicitur contractus innominatus. FACIO UT DES, DO UT FACIAS, unde debet regulari iuxta naturam contractuum quibus assimilatur, assimilatur autem emptioni, & venditoni propter prætium quod datur ratione periculi, quia qui assecurationem facit propter prætium dicitur emere eventium periculi. Decisio Rotæ Genuæ tertia, num. 28 & decis. 39, no. 9.2

Contractus assecurationisid est avertendi periculi,dicitur contractus innominatus.FACIO UT DES, DO UT FACIAS, unde debet regulari iuxta naturam contractuum quibus assimilatur, assimilatur autem emptioni, & venditoni propter prætium quod datur ratione periculi, qui assecurationem facit propter prætium dicitur emere eventium periculi.Decisio Rotæ Genuæ tertia, num. 28 & decis.39, no. 9.2

Insurance policies, and bills of exchange, were unknown to the ancient Roman jurisprudence and are the posthumous invention of Jews, according to the remark of Giovan Villani in his universal history.3

根据乔万·维拉尼在他的世界历史中的评论，保险单和汇票在古罗马法学中是不存在的，是犹太人的后世发明。3

When these abominable circumcised4 were banned from France because of their wrongdoings and their execrable crimes, and their assets were seized, at the time of King Dagobert , King Philip Augustus , and King Philip the Tall ,5 in order to retrieve their commodities and money, which they had consigned to or hidden in the hands of their friends before leaving, necessity taught these malicious men lacking public trust to use secret letters and bills written with few words and little substance, as bills of exchange still are, addressed to those who had received and concealed their stolen goods and given Jews a hand. Jews carried out these tasks by employing travelers and foreign merchants.

当这些可恶的割礼者4因为他们的错误行为和可恶的罪行而被禁止进入法国，他们的资产被没收，在达戈贝尔国王、菲利普·奥古斯都国王和高个子菲利普国王的时候。5为了取回他们的商品和金钱，这些商品和金钱在离开之前被托付或藏在他们的朋友手中，必要性使这些缺乏公共信任的恶人学会了使用秘密信件和写得字数不多、内容不多的票据，就像现在的汇票一样，写给那些接收和藏匿他们的赃物并给犹太人提供帮助的人。犹太人通过雇佣旅行者和外国商人来执行这些任务。

And having succeeded in this scheme, in order not to be deceived on the exchange rate, or in order to make a profit, they kept themselves informed au pair & à la touche , that is to say, about the intrinsic goodness, the metal purity and impurity of currencies,6 so that they would not be mistaken about the value and reduction of the different exchange rates of each currency, whose rates have always changed and varied in each province, much more in the past than at present; and this was the origin of bills of exchange, as Villani says.

在这个计划成功之后，为了不在汇率上受骗，或者为了获利，他们一直在了解“对” 和 “摸”，也就是说，了解货币的内在品质、金属纯度和杂质。6这样他们就不会对每种货币的不同汇率的价值和减少产生误解，，其汇率在每个省总是变化和变动，在过去比现在更多；这就是汇票的起源，正如维拉尼所说。

In order to retrieve their movable goods, their commodities, and their other belongings in the Jewish fashion and to the risk and danger of those who performed that service for them, their mistrust suggested to them the invention of a rudimentary beginning of what became insurance certificates or policies, through which all the risks and dangers of a voyage fell onto those who had insured the goods, on condition that a gift or a modest price, which today is called premium , be paid; it follows that bills of exchange and insurance policies are Jewish from birth, both in their invention and name . Polizza di cambio, Polizza di sicuranza .

为了以犹太人的方式取回他们的动产、商品和其他物品，并让那些为他们提供这种服务的人承担风险和危险，他们的不信任向他们建议，发明了一个初步的开始，即后来的保险证书或保单，通过它，航行的所有风险和危险都落在那些为货物投保的人身上，条件是必须支付礼物或适度的价格，今天称为保险费；因此，汇票和保险单从出生起就是犹太人的，无论是其发明还是名称。Polizza di cambio, Polizza di sicuranza.

The Italian Lombards, witnesses of and actors in this Jewish intrigue, after they retained the form of these letters, learned to use them effectively when in Italy the unhappy sects of Guelfs and Ghibellines , meaning the followers of the Pope and the Emperor, respectively, threatened each other, so to endeavor to supplant one another and put Christianity through great troubles and tumult.

意大利的伦巴第人是这一犹太阴谋的见证者和行动者，在他们保留了这些信件的形式后，学会了有效地使用它们，当时在意大利，Guelfs 和Ghibellines（分别指教皇和皇帝的追随者）这两个不愉快的教派相互威胁，所以要努力取代对方，使基督教经历巨大的麻烦和动荡。

The weakest, or the most timid among each party, took refuge in those places that they estimated to be safest or most favorable, where, in order to survive in the absence of other professions, they practiced usury and these Jewish inventions. And in order to protect themselves from ecclesiastical censure, which has always condemned every sort of usury and usurers, they skillfully succeeded in having their practices recognized—not just tolerated by connivance, but recognized as highly necessary to the exercise and maintenance of commerce and traffic. Usuram sub specie negotiationis palliantes ,7 as in reality those banking activities and insurances that are treated as honorable, upright, and legal activities are greatly useful and helpful to business, even according to the opinion of Cardinal Cajetan, the great theologian Thomas de Vio, in his Tractatus de cambijs , ch. 5,8and Navarrus , in his Enchiridio, ch. 17 , no. 284 .9

每一方中最弱的人，或最胆小的人，在他们估计最安全或最有利的地方避难，为了在没有其他职业的情况下生存，他们在那里从事高利贷和这些犹太发明。为了保护自己不受教会的谴责 —— 教会一直谴责各种高利贷和高利贷者，他们巧妙地成功地使他们的做法得到承认 —— 不仅仅是被纵容，而是被承认为对商业和交通的行使和维持非常必要。Usuram sub specie negotiationis palliantes。7因为在现实中，那些被视为光荣的、正直的、合法的银行活动和保险活动对商业有很大的帮助和作用，甚至根据红衣主教卡耶坦、伟大的神学家托马斯·德·维奥在他的Tractatus de cambijs, 第五章中的观点。8和纳瓦鲁斯，在他的Enchiridio，第 17 章，第 284 页。9

The Guelfs who found refuge in France, Avignon, England, and in the countries of obedience10 were initially favored and supported, notably at the [papal] court of Avignon, in the name of which they had been exiled from their homes; they succeeded in obtaining the grace and the dispensations of the [papal] court of Rome, thanks to which they attributed to themselves and took the venerable title of Domini Papæ Mercatores et Scambiatores, ob murmurantibus tamen Iudæis , as Matthew Paris says in his history of England, in vita RegisHenrici terij .11 We ought to consider that in those times as well as today usury was strictly prohibited before the tribunal of conscience ,12 and it was only tolerated for the miserable Jews, as people without conscience. Cap. quanto amplius. De usuris extra .13 The unexpected arrival of this sort of usurers from south of the Alps caused them [i.e., the Jews] great discontent and pain, because they [i.e., the Jews] saw that their imitators , their disciples, their acolytes, and their wretched clerks had mastered the art of usury to an even greater extent than they did; they [i.e., Lombard bankers] had become even more evil and malicious insofar as usury and rapaciousness were concerned; they bent and concocted their practices, and extracted from people greater profits and loot than Jews dared to aim for or demand; and those scoundrels were now being treated as noblemen, held in esteem as men of honor and merit, and considerably well-placed in their favors—e lodati ne van, non che impuniti14 —whereas Jews were hated, treated as jackanapes, and continuously ridiculed with contempt and affront, marked with a yellow hat, harassed as pages and lackeys at every occasion, in the same way as it is described in the search that the Master cook does of his waiter or gourmet in the comedy I supposti , written by Messer Ludovico Ariosto : Sera rimasto a dare caccia à qualche cane, ad ogni cosache truova per via se ferma, se vede facchino, o vilano o Giudeo, non lo terriano le cattene, che non li andasse à fare qualche dispiacere .15

在法国、阿维尼翁、英国和顺从国找到避难所的古尔菲们10起初受到青睐和支持，特别是在阿维尼翁的教皇法庭，他们以该法庭的名义被放逐出家园；他们成功地获得了罗马教皇法庭的恩典和宽限，由于这些，他们把自己归于罗马，并获得了令人尊敬的称号：Domini Papæ Mercatores et Scambiatores, ob murmurantibus tamen Iudæis，正如马修·帕里斯在其英国历史中所说，在 vita RegisHenrici terij。11我们应该考虑到，在那个时代和今天一样，高利贷在良知的法庭上被严格禁止。12只有可悲的犹太人，作为没有良心的人，才会被容忍。Cap. quanto amplius.De usuris extra.13这种来自阿尔卑斯山以南的高利贷者的意外到来使他们即犹太人非常不满和痛苦，因为他们即犹太人看到他们的模仿者、他们的弟子、他们的信徒和他们可恶的文员已经掌握了高利贷的艺术，甚至比他们更厉害；他们即。伦巴第银行家在高利贷和贪婪方面变得更加邪恶和恶毒；他们歪曲和捏造他们的做法，从人们身上榨取比犹太人敢于瞄准或要求的更大的利润和掠夺；这些无赖现在被当作贵族对待，作为有荣誉和功绩的人受到尊重，并在他们的宠爱中得到相当大的地位 —— e lodati ne van, non che impuniti14而犹太人则被憎恨，被当作傻瓜，不断受到蔑视和侮辱，被戴上黄帽子，在任何场合都被当作仆人和奴才来骚扰，就像卢多维科·阿里奥斯托先生写的喜剧《我想》中厨师长对他的侍者或美食家的搜寻所描述的那样。我已经准备好了，要给你的手杖来点颜色看看，如果你看到了你的脸，或者是维拉诺，或者是朱迪奥，就不要再去找你的手杖了，你不要再去做什么了。15

But the hypocrisy or fake probity of these Guelf bankers was soon recognized and condemned by the people, who named them Caorsini as a considerable offense and insult. Caursini, et caursinorum pestis abominanda ,16Boccaccio, Deorum Genealogiæ, book 14, ch. 11.17[See also] master Adam Théveneau in his learned and serious treatise about the laws on usury, article 1.18It is from them [usurers] that the Italian noun scarcità, cio è avaricia, scarci, avari, scarcella derives: the bag or purse19 ; the said epithet or nickname ca[o]rsins was given to them from the town of Cahors in Quercy, where this vermin reached its highest level under the pontificate of Pope John XXII, who was a native of that town.20 This fact was a big scandal and gave a bad reputation to the town of Cahors, which was under a curse because of those usurers and was considered to be as abhorrent as Sodom . On this subject the poet Dante in his Inferno, canto XI, puts in the same circle those who suffered bad luck, those burning from sulphur, those suffering in anguish and eternal sorrow, Sodom and Cahors , together with all the biggest scoundrel cheaters, dishonest people,21 teasers, charlatans,22 those who went bankrupt, insolvent debtors condemned to wear a green hat,23 fraudulent sellers,24 usurers who count every month and every cent,25sybarites, sycophants, calumniators, rodents,26scrubbers,27counterfeiters, inventors of taxes and subsides, impostors, holders of unlawful claim forms,28tax collectors, those who purchase and collect remittances of money and other things of no worth,29prison guards,30troublemakers,31servants and attendants,32diviners of the future ,33poisoners, werewolves, and sorcerers, and all other damned people whose reputation is tainted by the horrible sin against nature, mortal enemies of all human kind, who will never be part of the kingdom of God. Saint Paul’s Epistle to the Ephesians, ch. 5, verses 3–5.34

但这些贵族银行家的虚伪或假正经很快就被人们所认识并谴责，他们把他们命名为Caorsini，作为一种相当大的冒犯和侮辱。Caursini, et caursinorum pestis abominanda,16Boccaccio,Deorum Genealogiæ, book 14, ch. 11.17另见亚当·泰维诺大师在他关于高利贷法律的博学而严肃的论述中，第 1 条。18意大利名词scarcità，cio è avaricia，scarci，avari，scarcella就是从他们高利贷者那里来的：袋子或钱包。19的；上述外号或绰号 罪孽是从克尔西的卡奥尔镇给他们的，在教皇约翰二十二世（他是该镇人）的教皇统治下，这种害虫达到了最高水平。20这一事实是一个很大的丑闻，给卡奥尔镇带来了不好的名声，因为这些高利贷者，卡奥尔镇受到了诅咒，被认为是像索多玛一样可恶。在这个问题上，诗人但丁在他的《地狱》第十一章中，把那些遭受厄运的人、被硫磺灼伤的人、在痛苦和永恒的悲伤中煎熬的人、索多玛和卡奥尔，以及所有最大的恶棍骗子、不诚实的人放在同一个圈子中。21戏弄人的人，骗子。22破产的人，无力偿还债务的人，被判处戴绿帽子的人。23欺诈性的卖家。24计算每个月和每个分的高利贷者。25佞人、奸人、谗人、鼠辈。26擦洗者。27伪造者、税收和补贴的发明者、冒名顶替者、非法索赔表的持有者。28收税人、购买和收取金钱和其他不值钱的东西的人。29监狱看守。30闹事者。31仆人和服务员。32未来的占卜者。33毒师、狼人和巫师，以及所有其他被诅咒的人，他们的名声被违反自然的可怕罪行所玷污，他们是所有人类的死敌，他们永远不会成为神国的一部分。圣保罗的《以弗所书》，第五章，第 3-5 节。34

E Sodoma e Caorsa
Et chi spregiando Dio, col cor favella,
La frode, on’ogni coscienza è morsa .35

而所多玛和卡奥萨
